 **document management, compliance, and access control** 
 .
 



  





**Submission Requirements** 




 • 
 **CV & Cover Letter** 
  highlighting relevant skills and past projects.
 



 • References will be requested from 
 **at least one full project completed in the last three years** 
 .

title: Manager System Engineering
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*
 Your role
   

  

 We are looking for a manager with a passion for leadership, someone who takes joy and pride in helping coworkers to develop their skills, perform well and stay healthy. There are two System Engineering sections and you will work in close cooperation with the other manager.
   

  

 The main tasks are:
   

  

* Cost center budget and result
* Develop and maintain competences within the section
* Dialogue with projects and other managers to find the best solutions
* Together with the other Systems Engineering manager develop processes and methods


 As a member of the 9LV Systems Management Team within Business Unit Naval Combat Systems (NCS), you will play a key role in delivering world-class Command and Control solutions to armed forces globally. This position requires active collaboration with all members of the management team and the ability to represent the team's interests across the wider organization in various forums.
   

  

 NCS operates through local sites in Sweden, Australia, Finland, and Germany. The Systems department, with its seven line sections and approximately 150 employees, provides a collaborative and supportive environment. You will report to the Head of Systems.
   

  

 The position is based in Järfälla, Sweden and travel may be required, mainly to local sites within Sweden.
   

  

 Your Profile
   

  

 We expect you to have very strong communication-, leadership- and change management skills. We believe that you have a proactive attitude at work and can actively navigate around the organization and communicate with our internal stakeholders to prevent and solve problems and challenges that arise. A natural curiosity about technology and its applications is something we highly value.
   

  

 Required skills:
   

  

* A genuine interest to lead and coach people
* In-depth knowledge of systems engineering
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English, verbal and written
* Ability and interest in making improvements happen
* Master degree in engineering, or equivalent


 Desired skills:
   

  

* Experience as a manager
* A background in Systems Engineering
* Experience of Design Responsibility
* Experience of military products


 Saab is an international organization and it is important that you handle both Swedish and English fluently, verbally and written.
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Do you want to get to know our business and our people a little bit better? Here you can find some stories told by our employees.
   

  

 Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.

title: Cloud Solution Architect
description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential and excitement for the journey ahead.
   

  

 As Cloud Solution Architect, you will gather customer/partner insights and leverages these insights to design architectures, provide expertise/guidance and develop Microsoft solutions to achieve customer/partner business outcomes and drive to completion the resolution/unblocking of their issues, resulting in accelerated consumption. This opportunity will allow you to leverage knowledge of the products, services, and value propositions of Microsoft and its competitors in customer/partner conversations to identify growth opportunities.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will act as the voice of the customer (VOC)/partner by learning to identify and share feedback around technical capabilities, blockers and insights that relate to the customer/partner with internal teams.
* You will demonstrate basic technical concepts and prove those design solutions' capability through design collaboration sessions with the customer/partner and support customer skilling needs by participating in discussions on technical delivery with other internal and external stakeholders to transfer knowledge and contribute to customer readiness.
* With supervision, you will identify issues and advises customers/partners to operate and optimize performance in accordance with Microsoft best practices and apply methodology and governance, as directed, to minimize business and technical risks and adhere to quality assurance while ensuring excellence in contributions to design and/or delivery of solutions.
* You will learn about the products, services, and value propositions of Microsoft's Cloud and support businesses and share learnings with others (e.g., peer groups, customers) as appropriate and assess customer/partner needs and gather information that helps others to identify growth opportunities.
* You will learn to identify and communicate areas in intellectual property (IP) that need refreshing or have gaps and contribute to IP development with guidance/supervision.
* You will leverage development opportunities (e.g., mentorships, role-based resources, training courses, internal events such as Ready, Build, Ignite) to learn new technologies or services.
* You will embody our culture and values.


**Qualifications**
**Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND 1+ year(s) work or internship experience involving cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
* OR equivalent experience
* Fluent in both English and Swedish


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree (or currently pursuing) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND 2+ years experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
* OR equivalent experience
* Technical Certification in Cloud (e.g., Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google, security certifications)


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Regeringskansliet söker en it-säkerhetsarkitekt
description:
**Sektionen för it-säkerhet, Förvaltningsavdelningen**
 Är du intresserad av att arbeta med it-säkerhet i en komplex och geografiskt spridd miljö? Vill du bidra till att Sveriges regering, Regeringskansliet och ambassader har it-system med rätt säkerhet? Vi söker nu en erfaren it-säkerhetsarkitekt.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Som it-säkerhetsarkitekt arbetar du brett med it-säkerhetsfrågor och vidareutvecklar vår it-säkerhetsarkitektur för att stödja digitalisering och möta omvärldens snabba förändringar. Du samarbetar med it-säkerhetschef, specialister, team, projekt och leverantörer för att skydda information enligt överenskomna nivåer. Duhåller dig uppdaterad om vad som händer i omvärlden, både vad gäller hotbilder, arbetsmetoder, teknologier och produkter och utvecklar it-säkerhetsarkitektur genom att skapa en roadmap för att stärka och säkerställa it-säkerhetsförmågor i både on prem och molnmiljöer.
   

  

 Följande arbetsuppgifter ingår bl a:
   

  

* Vidareutveckla och förvalta it-säkerhetsarkitektur
* Delta i arbetet med design av och implementation av säkerhetslösningar och leda krav- och lösningsworkshoppar
* Stödja tvärfunktionella team och projekt
* Bidra till att strategi, styrande principer och riktlinjer för it-säkerhetsarkitektur efterlevs och kontinuerligt utvecklas


**Din bakgrund**
 Vi ser att du uppföljer följande krav:
   

  

* Högskoleexamen inom relevant område för rollen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet som it-säkerhetsarkitekt för on prem och molnmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av it-säkerhet i miljöer med höga säkerhetskrav
* Kunskap om molnlösningar och deras säkerhetsfunktioner


 Följande kunskaper och erfarenheter är meriterande:
   

  

* Certifieringar inom it-säkerhet/arkitektur
* Erfarenhet av riskhantering, sårbarhetshantering, kontinuitetsplanering och kravställning mot leverantörer
* Erfarenhet av projektledning, M365 och Azure Security-funktioner, DevSecOps
* Erfarenhet av arbete vid myndighet, offentlig sektor eller global verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av ackreditering för säkerhetsskyddsklassade informationssystem
* Kunskap om föreskrifter och standarder inom informations- och it-säkerhet (CIS, NIST, ISO 27000)
* Kunskap om NATO-regelverk och tekniska lösningar för säkerhetsskyddsklassadinformation
* Goda kunskaper inom design av IT-infrastruktur, nätverk, kryptering, åtkomst/behörighetshantering, applikationsdrift och operativsystem


**Dina egenskaper** 
 Vi fäster stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som motiveras av komplexa utmaningar Du har förmåga att kommunicera säkerhetsrelaterade frågor på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt och kan arbeta mot uppsatta mål med efterfrågat resultat. Din analytiska förmåga och strategiska tankesätt gör att du självständigt och initiativtagande kan drivakomplexa projekt framåt. Du planerar, organiserar och prioriterar arbetet på ett effektivt sätt Du är ansvarsfull, noggrann och strukturerad, och har god samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga. Då arbetet utförs i nära samarbete med dina kollegor är viktigt att du har god samarbetsförmåga, uppskattar teamarbete och har lätt för att skapa förtroende och bygga goda relationer.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att hålla sig uppdaterad om aktuella hot och risker inom it-säkerhet. Du har god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Övrigt** 
 Tills vidare anställning med 6 månaders provanställning. Våra anställningar är placerade i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Du måste vara svensk medborgare. Beredskapstjänstgöring, resor till utlandsmyndigheter och visst arbete utanför ordinarie arbetstid kan förekomma.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?** 
 Skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev senast den 1 april 2025. Ansökan och personligt brev ska vara på svenska.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta sektionschef Lena Andersson Nordgren eller rekryteringsspecialist Carl Garellick. Fackliga representanter är Johan Strokirk (Saco) och Jan Wahlström (ST). Samtliga nås via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00.
   

  

 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Förvaltningsavdelningen ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor som förändrings- och förnyelsearbete, ekonomi, arbetsgivarfrågor, kompetensförsörjning, kommunikation, säkerhet, it, bibliotek, arkiv och registratur samt för den gemensamma servicen i Regeringskansliet.

title: Service Delivery Manager - Finance IT
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 In our Finance IT team, we ensure that our IT services support and enhance financial processes, driving efficiency and business success. We are now looking for an experienced IT Service Delivery Manager with Agile Project Management expertise to strengthen our team.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 As an IT Service Delivery Manager – Finance IT, you will take the lead in managing and improving IT services for Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable. This role is a unique combination of service delivery management, stakeholder collaboration, process optimization, and Agile project leadership.
   

  

 You will ensure that IT services run smoothly, meet business needs, and continuously improve. Partnering with IT teams, vendors, and business stakeholders, you will drive innovation, ensure compliance, and optimize service performance. If you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can make a real impact, this is the role for you!
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
**IT Service Delivery & Performance**
* Oversee end-to-end IT service delivery for Finance IT systems.
* Ensure system availability, performance, and alignment with business needs.
* Monitor and manage SLAs, KPIs, and service quality.
* Implement incident and problem management strategies to minimize disruptions.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives using Agile methodologies.


**Leadership & Stakeholder Collaboration**
* Lead IT support teams, fostering high-quality service and operational efficiency.
* Act as the primary point of contact between IT and business stakeholders.
* Facilitate clear communication between IT teams, vendors, and internal customers.
* Manage customer expectations and handle escalations proactively.


**Vendor & Compliance Management**
* Collaborate with external IT vendors to ensure service excellence.
* Align vendor Service Level Agreements (SLAs) with business requirements.
* Ensure IT services comply with security, governance, and regulatory standards.
* Identify and mitigate IT-related risks to safeguard service stability.


**Agile Project Management**
* Work closely with project teams to drive Agile execution and collaboration.
* Define project goals, roadmaps, and deliverables.
* Adapt to evolving business needs while maintaining IT service stability.


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a strategic and forward-thinking leader with a passion for IT service excellence and Agile project management. You have a strong technical foundation, leadership skills, and a problem-solving mindset. You bring:
   

  

  

* A degree in IT or equivalent experience.
* Experience in IT support and service management, preferably in the finance sector.
* Knowledge of cloud solutions, IT security, infrastructure, and integrations.
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to guide teams toward success.
* Experience managing projects using Agile principles and working methods.
* Familiarity with finance systems, Accounts Payable, and Accounts Receivable (preferred).
* Proficiency in English for effective communication across teams and stakeholders.


**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-04-01. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Business Analayst - Salesforce Consultant
description:
**Freelance Opportunity: Salesforce Techno-Functional Consultant (Telecom) – Stockholm** 




  





 We’re looking for an experienced Freelance Salesforce Techno-Functional Consultant (10+ years) to lead product vision, stakeholder engagement, and Salesforce solution design within the telecom sector.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 



  




* Define business requirements and create BRS documents.
* Map functional requirements to Salesforce CRM, CPQ, and CLM capabilities.
* Drive stakeholder engagement, backlog management, and product roadmap planning.
* Ensure system integration, UAT, release management, and risk mitigation.
* Mentor teams on Salesforce best practices.



  





 Required Skills:
 



  




* Salesforce Techno-Functional expertise (Sales & Service Processes).
* Fluent in Swedish.
* Experience in telecom BSS & Salesforce Communication Cloud (preferred).



  





 This is a freelance role based in Stockholm with hybrid working options.
 



 Let’s connect if you’re interested!

title: Senior Business Manager
description:
**Senior Manager - Drive Growth & Lead Excellence at ALTEN** 




  





 Report to:
 **Automotive Division Director** 




  





**Are you a strategic leader with a passion for driving business growth and developing talent in the Automotive industry?** 
 Join ALTEN, a global leader in engineering and technology consulting, and step into a pivotal role as a Senior Manager. This is your opportunity to shape the future, lead a high-performing team, and contribute directly to our continued success.
 



  





**Why ALTEN?** 




  





 Choosing ALTEN means joining a dynamic and innovative company where your contributions are valued and your career growth is prioritized. You'll be part of a global network, working on cutting-edge projects with leading clients across various industries. At ALTEN, we believe in empowering our people, providing them with the resources and support they need to excel. This role offers:
 



  




* **Leadership Development:** 
 Coach and mentor managers, fostering their professional development and success.
* **Strategic Growth:** 
 Lead the expansion into new geographical areas and the development of innovative service offerings.
* **Entrepreneurial Environment:** 
 Enjoy the autonomy to shape your approach and drive results within a supportive framework.
* **Career Advancement:** 
 ALTEN prioritizes internal growth, offering clear pathways for career progression.



  





**Main responsabilities:** 




  




* Participate in the development of the division's business and activity plan.
* Drive organizational development for continuous and profitable growth.
* Establish and manage the department's budget, ensuring financial accountability.
* Coach and mentor subordinate managers to achieve their targets.
* Lead by example, demonstrating professionalism and commitment.
* Ensure adherence to ALTEN’s brand strategy, policies, and procedures.
* Maintain accurate reporting of key performance indicators, forecasts, and wage-related information.
* Uphold security and confidentiality standards.



  





**The Expertise We Seek:** 




  





 We're not just looking for a manager; we're seeking a seasoned leader who has honed their skills through years of impactful experience. To thrive in this role, you'll bring a minimum of
 **15 years of proven success in sales, people management and a good understanding of the Automotive industry and you have a good Swedish level.** 
 This isn't just about time served; it's about the depth of understanding, the strategic insights, and the refined leadership abilities that come from navigating complex sales environments and nurturing high-performing teams.
 



  





**Think of it this way:** 
 We need someone who has not only seen the peaks and valleys of sales cycles but has also mastered the art of building and empowering teams to consistently achieve exceptional results.
 



  





 You've guided and mentored countless individuals, shaping them into future leaders. Your experience is your advantage, your wisdom is your strength, and your ability to apply it strategically will be instrumental in driving ALTEN's continued success.
 



  





**Join ALTEN and be a key driver of our continued success!**

title: Cloud Solution Architect
description:
**Overview**
 Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential and excitement for the journey ahead.
   

  

 As Cloud Solution Architect, you will gather customer/partner insights and leverages these insights to design architectures, provide expertise/guidance and develop Microsoft solutions to achieve customer/partner business outcomes and drive to completion the resolution/unblocking of their issues, resulting in accelerated consumption. This opportunity will allow you to leverage knowledge of the products, services, and value propositions of Microsoft and its competitors in customer/partner conversations to identify growth opportunities.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will act as the voice of the customer (VOC)/partner by learning to identify and share feedback around technical capabilities, blockers and insights that relate to the customer/partner with internal teams.
* You will demonstrate basic technical concepts and prove those design solutions' capability through design collaboration sessions with the customer/partner and support customer skilling needs by participating in discussions on technical delivery with other internal and external stakeholders to transfer knowledge and contribute to customer readiness.
* With supervision, you will identify issues and advises customers/partners to operate and optimize performance in accordance with Microsoft best practices and apply methodology and governance, as directed, to minimize business and technical risks and adhere to quality assurance while ensuring excellence in contributions to design and/or delivery of solutions.
* You will learn about the products, services, and value propositions of Microsoft's Cloud and support businesses and share learnings with others (e.g., peer groups, customers) as appropriate and assess customer/partner needs and gather information that helps others to identify growth opportunities.
* You will learn to identify and communicate areas in intellectual property (IP) that need refreshing or have gaps and contribute to IP development with guidance/supervision.
* You will leverage development opportunities (e.g., mentorships, role-based resources, training courses, internal events such as Ready, Build, Ignite) to learn new technologies or services.
* You will embody our culture and values.


**Qualifications**
**Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND 1+ year(s) work or internship experience involving cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
* OR equivalent experience
* Fluent in both English and Swedish


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree (or currently pursuing) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND 2+ years experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
* OR equivalent experience
* Technical Certification in Cloud (e.g., Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google, security certifications)


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .
   

  

 Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Director, Consult Partner--Application Services
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Kyndryl Consult is the fastest growing business within the organization and instrumental to the company’s strategic growth objectives. You will play a key leadership role across multi-disciplinary teams, guiding them through complex consulting engagements and be responsible for creating and positioning strategic change agendas within Kyndryl's largest accounts across the C-suite, spanning the intersection between complex Business and IT customer solutions, transformations that impact across the entire customer Eco-system.
   

  

 As a Consult Partner, you will have a pivotal role in driving profitable growth, leveraging our comprehensive capabilities to build strong client relationships, and leading your team to success. This role demands a strong presence, industry expertise, and the ability to cultivate relationships with CXO-level clients. Your leadership will be critical in fostering talent development and innovation within the organization.
   

  

 This role will also be leading the overall client engagement and delivering high quality client work alongside senior client stakeholders. Working in a transaction environment which may be pre or post deal, planning post deal implementation, and ultimately supporting execution. Partners will be focused on financial impact, utilization and contribution, client impact and leadership.
   

  

 Contribute to Profitable Growth:
   

  

* Drive significant financial outcomes through signings and revenue targets
* Ensure sustained growth and profitability, managing margin expectations and backlog growth
* Support the identification, pursuit and conversion of a pipeline of business development opportunities
* Undertake scoping and fee negotiation on engagements, while enduring profitability and understanding and containing risk


 Client Engagement:
   

  

* Build and maintain deep relationships with client CXOs and be seen as the 'go to' person and a trusted advisor by senior executives
* Leading C-level client interactions and consulting initiatives, deliverables and outputs of a deal engagement
* Demonstrate credibility and experience to advise and deliver on complex consulting engagement
* Enhance client satisfaction, as measured by Net Promoter Score (NPS) and new relationship development; Secure client references


 Operational Excellence:
   

  

* Achieve individual and team utilization targets
* Lead the design of complex engagements and take responsibility for oversight of delivery, ensuring high performance and customer satisfaction


 Leadership, Management, People
   

  

* Lead by example; Fostering a culture of continuous personal and professional development and challenging our people to be curious and innovative and supportive for each other. At the same time ensuring that all outcomes are commercially focused, value adding and effectively executed


 Strategic Contribution:
   

  

* Utilize industry and technology expertise to shape and drive the company’s strategic initiatives.
* Align with Kyndryl’s strategic vision and contribute to its execution.
* Drive external eminence and innovation, establishing a strong personal and organizational brand in the industry.
* Proactively develop thought leadership and intellectual capital


**Who You Are**
 Who You Are
   

  

 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* 15+ years of experience in IT consulting and Sales, with focus on application services
* Extensive experience in client engagement and relationship management at the CXO level
* Demonstrable ability to build and commercialize relationships with senior executives
* Proven track record of leading and executing complex projects with multi-disciplinary teams in a consulting, corporate or public sector environment
* Effective financial acumen with experience in driving revenue growth and managing margins
* Experience of managing or supporting high-value business development activities with senior stakeholders
* Deep understanding of industry trends and technology
* Sound personal brand and presence in the industry
* Demonstrated ability to innovate and drive change
* Industry experience in Retail & Industrial Sectors
* Proven track record in pre-sales activities and solution design for large-scale Application Services engagements


**Preferred Skills and Experience:**
* Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree
* Sales experience in technical solutions


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Kommerskollegium söker driven it-ansvarig
company: Kommerskollegium | National Board of Trade Sweden
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Kommerskollegium är Sveriges myndighet för utrikeshandel, handelsrelaterat internationellt utvecklingssamarbete, EU:s inre marknad och handelspolitik och arbetar bland annat med frågor som EU:s frihandelsavtal, svenska företags möjligheter att importera och exportera och fattigdomsbekämpning genom handel.
   

  

 På Kommerskollegium befinner du dig i en internationell miljö där de stora handelspolitiska frågorna blandas med konkret problemlösning för enskilda företag och individer. Vår vision är en hållbar handel utan hinder. Hos oss arbetar cirka 100 medarbetare. Vårt nya aktivitetsbaserade kontor är beläget centralt i Stockholm.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Vi söker nu en driven it-ansvarig med lösningsfokus som vill arbeta självständigt i en bred och omväxlande roll. Kommerskollegiums verksamhet utvecklas med nya uppdrag och förutsättningar och i den utvecklingsresan har du en viktig roll att fylla. Du kommer att vara involverad i frågor som till exempel säkerhetsskydd, informationssäkerhet, it-stöd för vår växande biståndsverksamhet och utlandsplaceringar, att stärka myndighetens roll inom totalförsvaret och ett eventuellt kommande uppdrag som beredskapsmyndighet med sektorsansvar. Du kommer också att bidra till myndighetens fysiska säkerhet, med utrustning och funktioner i en hybrid arbetsvardag och annan utveckling i linje med kärnverksamhetens behov.
   

  

 Kommerskollegium är en fullservicemyndighet hos Försäkringskassans it-drift och du har i det en central roll som beställare vad gäller planering, budgetering och uppföljning. Du hör till myndighetens administrativa enhet, en mindre enhet där vi hjälps åt och ställer upp för varandra, vilket gör att andra uppgifter inom enheten kan förekomma.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har högskoleutbildning med inriktning mot it eller annan utbildning tillsammans med erfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig. Du har erfarenhet av arbete i samordnar-/beställarroll inom it. Du har flerårig erfarenhet av utveckling, drift och förvaltning av it-miljöer. För att fungera väl i rollen ser vi också att du har erfarenhet av projektledning, arbete med it-säkerhet och it-stöd i medarbetarnas arbetsvardag. Vår it-plattform är Microsoftbaserad och det är viktigt för arbetet att du har kunskaper i det. Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet från arbete vid eller gentemot statlig myndighet och av säkerhetsskyddsarbete.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är driven och lösningsfokuserad. I fokus har du resultat som är till nytta för verksamheten. Du är lyhörd, smidig och kommunikativ gentemot andra och uppskattas för ditt sätt att samarbeta. Vidare är du självgående, tycker om att ta ansvar och driver dina processer framåt på egen hand och på ett lyckat sätt.
   

  

 Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och kräver därför svenskt medborgarskap. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av att arbeta hos oss men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.

title: MS Intune Specialist till Axfood IT, Stockholm
description:
Välkommen till Axfood IT, en av de ledande tech-aktörerna i branschen och en central del av Axfood, en av Sveriges främsta mataktörer. Vi har länge varit i framkant när det gäller att driva innovation och utveckling inom både IT och livsmedelssektorn. Som en av dagligvarubranschens största aktörer gör vi inom Axfood skillnad i miljontals människors liv – varje dag. Tillsammans vill vi skapa mer livskvalitet för alla vi berör genom våra olika koncept, verksamheter och varumärken. Vi tror på ständig förbättring och utveckling, och på att visa omtanke till omvärlden medan vi förändras.
   

  

  

  

 På Axfood IT stöttar vi hela Axfoodkoncernen med de senaste digitala lösningarna. Med ett team på cirka trehundra medarbetare, utforskar vi ständigt nya sätt att utmana och förbättra våra teknologiska plattformar. Genom att använda den senaste tekniken, skapa en kreativ arbetsmiljö och främja ett aktivt inkluderingsarbete, strävar vi efter att ge varje medarbetare de bästa förutsättningarna att växa och trivas hos oss. Vår passion för innovation driver oss att leverera lösningar som gör skillnad, både för våra kollegor och våra kunder.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 Vårt team Digitalt Arbetssätt söker nu en MS Intune Specialist. Här får du möjlighet att påverka och bygga upp samt managera produkten från SCCM till Intune för primärt mobila enheter.
   

  

* Vi söker en driven senior profil som kan managera, utveckla, designa och bygga upp MS Intune för primärt mobila enheter, men även arbete i Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM). Erfarenhet av användarhantering krävs (GPO/AD/Entra), både On-prem och Azure Cloud.
* Du har några års erfarenhet från storbolag (Enterprise) gärna Retail (Lager, kontor och butik).


**Det här får du göra**
 I rollen som MS Intune Specialist hos oss får du jobba med:
   

  

* Tekniskt ansvarig för att utveckla/konfigurera och bygga upp MS Intune för mobila enheter inom Workplace teamet för koncernen både gällande strategier och förflyttning till molnet.
* Inställningar och policies med hjälp av GPO:er samt förflyttning till CloudNative och policies via Intune.
* Integrationer med Microsoft 365


**Stämmer detta in på dig?**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har:
   

  

* Du har flera års erfarenhet från större Enterprise bolag i rollen som ansvarig för mobila enheter i Intune
* Du har jobbat med konfigurering, förvaltning, design, policys och utveckling inom Intune
* Erfarenhet av migrering från On-prem till Cloud (Azure) lösningar och M365
* Gärna erfarenhet av säkerhet, PowerShell, SCCM och certifikatshantering
* Du är driven, kommunikativ, bra på att samarbeta och har erfarenhet av en liknande roll sedan tidigare.
* Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat


**Ansökningsprocessen**
 Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt att söka jobb hos oss. Om du inte har ett CV redo räcker det med att du länkar en väl ifylld LinkedInprofil. I din ansökan får du svara på de frågor vi behöver svar på i den här delen av processen, och personligt brev är därför inte obligatoriskt.
   

  

 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan därför tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag den 15/3/2025 Vår rekryteringsprocess innehåller tester intervjuer och bakgrundskontroll, och vi kan därför komma att be dig om ditt personnummer. Observera att vi inte under denna rekryteringsprocess kommer be dig logga in med ditt Bank-id eller scanna någon QR-kod.
   

  

 Vid frågor kontakta Medarbetarsupporten på jobb@axfood.se. Läs mer: Så går det till när du söker jobb inom Axfood. Om du har frågor om tjänsten, kontakta elisabeth.wehlin@axfood.se. Av GDPR-skäl behandlar vi inga ansökningar eller annan personlig information via mail.

title: OctaLIMS Corporate System Administrator, Octapharma Kungsholmen
description:
Do you want to combine the opportunities that a global company provides with the benefits of a family-owned business? Headquartered in Lachen near Zurich, Switzerland, the Octapharma Group is a leading company in the worldwide market for therapeutic human proteins. Working at Octapharma means to have an opportunity to contribute to our common goal – developing lifesaving therapies to improve patients’ lives.
   

  

 What will you be doing as OctaLIMS Corporate System Administrator?
   

  

* Input of production-related master data and test plans into our laboratory Information systems octaLIMS (LabVantage)
* Administration of the overall system including definition of test methods and corresponding calculations in collaboration with our key users
* Further development and ongoing optimization of the system as well as support of (key) users as an interface to IT and octaLIMS administration, e.g. access and authorization management, incident management
* Conducting training courses and creating and maintenance of user manuals and SOPs
* Validation support for pre-qualification as well as support for audits and inspections


 Who are you?
   

  

* Degree in computer science, chemistry or biology with additional IT qualification
* (Good) knowledge of GMP and GAMP as well as strong technical understanding
* Knowledge of microbiology and/or chemical analysis as well as LIMS administration an advantage
* Experienced use of MS Office and very good knowledge of English and Swedish (written and spoken)


 What's the best thing about working with us?
   

  

* You help save lives - Every day is meaningful as we produce life-saving medicines
* Family values - Long-term perspective for employees and relationships
* Be rewarded with an attractive salary and benefits package
* You will have a high level of influence where you can make a difference and leave your footprint
* Work with skilled and fun colleagues in a relatively informal organization
* Skills development - We offer various internal and external employee and leadership trainings, trainee programs and digital solutions


 Apply Today!
   

  

 Please apply in English. If you have questions about the position, contact Johanna Hermansson (Head of recruitment) at johanna.hermansson@octapharma.com. The application deadline is 2025-04-17, but the position may be filled before then.
   

  

 If you proceed in the process
   

  

* We want to gather as much Information as possible early in the process to make the best match. Within a few days, you will perform work psychological assessment tests
* The assessment tests are done early in the process because we want to ensure an objective, unbiased and fair selection process


 Would you like to get to know us better? Learn more about us on our website and follow us daily on LinkedIn!

title: Engineering Manager
description:
****Ready to Lead the Future** 
 of Content Management?**
 At Paligo, we’re not just producing content—we’re
 **redefining** 
 how the world’s leading companies create, manage, and deliver technical documentation. As a
 **globally leading** 
 Component Content Management System (CCMS), Paligo is transforming traditional Content Management and the way technical information is crafted, organized, and accessed by major organizations like
 **Bitdefender** 
 ,
 **Bluetooth** 
 ,
 **Mitsubishi** 
 , the
 **European Commission** 
 ,
 **Wrike** 
 ,
 **Alteryx** 
 , and many more.
   

  

**As a team lead for one of our engineering team consisting of 5-6 developers,** 
 you’ll be part of our engineering organisation at our headquarters in
 **Solna, Stockholm** 
 , reporting directly to the
 **VP of Engineering** 
 . Paligo is a
 **global company** 
 with clients and teams spread across different locations, but our engineering team is primarily based in Solna, where we prioritize
 **in-office collaboration** 
 . We embrace a
 **hybrid working model** 
 , allowing for regular in-office meetings while offering flexibility for remote work when needed. However, the heart of our teamwork happens in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   

  

 We’re on a mission to become the
 **#1 solution** 
 in our industry, and we’re looking for a dynamic Team Manager who’s ready to help us
 **scale to new heights** 
 . If you love
 **leading top-notch engineering teams** 
 , solving
 **complex challenges** 
 , and setting
 **trends** 
 in the world of SaaS, this role is for you!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead and inspire a team of engineers to follow best-in-class development practices.
* Work closely with the code through hands-on coding, code review and design discussions.
* Partner with the Product Owner and stakeholders to launch stable, high-quality releases that keep Paligo ahead of the curve.
* Bridge the gap between teams, ensuring seamless communication and a united focus on our goals.
* Prioritize technical and customer needs to keep us laser-focused on delivering exceptional value.
* Cultivate a learning environment where knowledge is shared, collaboration thrives, and the team grows stronger together.
* Shape the future of your team by driving personalized growth plans, setting meaningful goals, and leading engaging 1-1s and dev talks.
* Own the Scrum process and guide the team through successful sprints, making every review count.
* Attract and retain top engineering talent, keeping Paligo at the forefront of innovation.


**What We’re Looking For**
* An enthusiastic leader who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Someone passionate about pushing boundaries and keeping the customer at the heart of every decision.
* An expert communicator who can seamlessly collaborate across teams and departments.
* 5 years hands-on web development experience.
* Experience with technologies like PHP, TypeScript, Python, Vue, AWS, Docker.
* A natural mentor with a knack for developing and inspiring high-performing teams.
* Experience in agile software development environments.
* Background in improving best practices and processes across development teams on a continuing basis.
* Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* Experience managing both onsite and remote engineers.


**Why You’ll Love Working At Paligo**
* You’ll be at the cutting edge of SaaS and CCMS innovation, working alongside industry leaders and trendsetters.
* We’re transitioning from a startup to a scale-up, and your contributions will shape the future of our company.
* A customer-first mindset drives everything we do—so you’ll directly impact the success of our global clients.
* We believe in open communication, collaboration, and a fun, healthy work culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.
* Our fast-growing, dynamic environment offers endless opportunities for growth and development.
* We recently moved into brand new modern offices within walking distance of transit and lunch destinations.
* We have great employee perks, including an annual Wellness contribution, Professional Development budget, Home office contribution, and Parental pay.


**Who We Are**
 At Paligo, we’re disrupting the CCMS landscape with our cloud-based platform that helps the world’s biggest brands manage technical, knowledge, and product documentation like never before. Our clients span industries and geographies, but they all have one thing in common: they trust Paligo to deliver the future of content management.
   

  

**Join Us in Making History**
 If you’re ready to lead a talented team of engineers and contribute to something truly game-changing, we’d love to hear from you! Curious about our culture and values? Check out our careers page here and get a feel for what it’s like to be part of the Paligo community.
   

  

 Paligo is an end-to-end Component Content Management System (CCMS) solution for technical documentation, policies and procedures, knowledge management, and more.

title: Service Solution Architect
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.
   

  

**The position**
 Cambio Customer Delivery Division´s mission is to be a scalable, reliable & trusted partner to our customers. This organization operates the services provided by Cambio to our customers.
   

  

 We are now eager to find our Service Solution Architect, to be our hub in ensuring that our customers’ needs are reflected into our enterprise architect strategy, making sure we design and build services and products that are relevant and secure. This position will be the interface for mapping our platforms and infrastructure, ensuring a continuously relevant topology of our IT ecosystem for our services in Cambio.
   

  

 The architect will be part of the Cambio IT management team, and be the owner of the design for the ecosystem forming the Cambio IT operational environment, working with pre-requisites for our IT partners, our suppliers and the managers of the daily operations of IT. The architect will be the hub for our technical system owners where you ensure that we have the needed capacity for delivering according to contracts and for making sure our new and improved services are set into operations in an efficient, reliable and scalable manner. You will also be a virtual part of the Cambio Enterprise Architect team, working with our high- level technical roadmaps.
   

  

 This is an excellent opportunity for you who thrive from customer satisfaction, and to be able to contribute to delivering not only on point but on a next level of delivery precision. This is done by working close with our customers and customer teams, translating needs into our own building capacity. This is a growing business where our customers have a desire to move fast and we need to make sure their journey is smooth and predictable – this is where your abilities will be on point, as a leader, expert and coach.
   

  

 Cambio is a company with employees from many countries, with many cultural backgrounds and creeds. We think that you share our belief that this diversity is a key building block in creating successful teams. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 To be comfortable and successful in this position, we see you as being able to communicate clearly and effectively on different levels and with different groups (from customers, developers and up to C-level management). Others describe you as solution-oriented, structured, and as someone who has both strong documentation and presentation skills. You enjoy understanding the big picture and how different things are connected, and how one can drive change based on this knowledge. You have experience from working with, and in, large scaled IT ecosystems, hence you know how to formulate need for facts and data. Lastly but most importantly, you are an empathic leader who values personal interactions and contributes to an atmosphere of cohesiveness and collaboration.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* 5-10 years’ experience working as Service Architect or a similar role, including strategic as well as service specific architecture.
* Significant breadth of knowledge and experience in IT technology.
* Confidence to work with and present to both customers and internal colleagues on a one-to-one basis and with larger groups.
* Good understanding of ITIL.
* In depth knowledge and implementation experience of a service management
* Ability to manage several large projects simultaneously, taking full ownership and management of the planning and execution of service design activities.
* Incorporating people, process, technology, and commercial aspects of service design to enable new solutions to be transitioned smoothly into operational service.
* Strong communication skills and proficiency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.
* Have experience of large scale/enterprise service deliveries or similar experience of operating complex systems at a large scale.


**It's a bonus if you**
* Have worked as solution architect/presales, and have experience from bid-management.
* Have experience of managing medium to larger technical teams.
* Have worked as a Customer service manager.
* Have experience from partner management.
* Have experience from cost models and financial models.


**Place of employment** 
 : Linköping or Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 The employee in this position will have access to sensitive data, necessitating background checks on the final candidate.
   

  

 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in
 **Sweden.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Utvecklingsledare IT till Utbildningskontoret
description:
**Vad är viktigt för dig på riktigt?** 
**Vill du skapa de bästa möjliga digitala förutsättningarna för barn och elever i deras utbildningsresa?**
 Arbetsuppgifterna som Utvecklingsledare IT på Utbildningskontoret innefattar både att självständigt driva projekt och processer, samt att arbeta tillsammans med kollegor, samarbetspartners och leverantörer. I rollen krävs det att du kan hantera och driva frågor på såväl operativ som strategisk nivå för att skapa bästa möjliga förutsättningar för kontorets fortsatta utveckling.
   

  

 Som Utvecklingsledare IT ansvarar du tillsammans med dina kollegor inom enheten för att kontoret har en robust och långsiktigt effektiv och funktionell IT-miljö som är lätt att förvalta och som uppfyller verksamheternas behov.
   

  

 Vi är i en ny utvecklingsfas för digitaliseringsarbetet med fokus informationssäkerhet, systemlösningar, skolplattform samt andra vitala systemstöd för våra verksamheter med ambitionen att skapa bättre förutsättningar för elever, medarbetare och medborgare. Utöver det driver vi ett gemensamt utökat datadrivet systematiskt kvalitetsarbete, vilket gör att AI och BI är högaktuella frågor för oss.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer vara att:
   

  

  

* samordna och synkronisera IT- och digitaliseringsinitiativ från utbildningskontorets verksamheter och kommungemensamma IT-avdelningen,
* projektleda systeminföranden i verksamheten och skapa förståelse för automatisering,
* driva och delta i IT-relaterade upphandlingar samt säkerställa kvaliteten utifrån leverantörsuppföljning,
* koordinera informationssäkerhetsarbetet på utbildningskontoret,
* samordna tidsplanering utvecklingsarbete och införandeplanering,
* delta i utvecklingsforum inom IT-området.


**Vem är du? Vi är nyfikna på dig.**
 Vi tror att du har arbetat med verksamhetsnära systemlösningar och projektledning i många år och vill arbeta med att skapa helhetslösningar för en större utbildningsverksamhet. Vi behöver din erfarenhet för att vidareutveckla våra digitala arbetssätt, driva interna införandeprojekt och samordna processer inom IT-området.
   

  

 Låter det här som intressanta utmaningar för dig?
   

  

 Personliga egenskaper:
   

  

  

* som person har du förmåga att självständigt se vad som behöver göras, ta initiativ samt vara duktig på att samordna ditt och kollegornas arbete framåt.
* du är analytisk, strukturerad, kommunikativ och har en förmåga att se helheten samtidigt som du kan hantera detaljer när det behövs.
* eftersom ditt arbete kommer att innefatta mycket kontakter med andra så blir en nyckel till framgång att du samordnar och lyckas väl i dina samarbeten.


 Krav:
   

  

  

* för att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha arbetat flera år med förvaltning och vidareutveckling av IT-lösningar utifrån verksamhetsperspektivet.
* att du är högskoleutbildad med riktning IT eller motsvarande kunskaper förvärvat på ett annat sätt ser vi som självklart.


 Du behöver vidare ha:
   

  

  

* erfarenhet och förståelse av projektledning utifrån behov som verksamheter och IT har.
* goda erfarenheter av upphandling och införande av system.
* förmåga att analysera, driva och kommunicera effektarbete inom digitalisering.
* erfarenhet av att presentera och rapportera till ledningsgrupp och styrgrupp eller liknande beslutsfattande organ.
* ett strategiskt synsätt, verksamhetsnära IT och en vana att arbeta långsiktigt.


 Meriterande:
   

  

  

* arbetat i offentlig förvaltning med utbildningsverksamhet.
* organiserat utvecklingsarbete som drivits i parallella projekt.
* intresse för informationssäkerhet.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Varje dag går ca 6 000 personer till sitt jobb i Södertälje kommun. Vi har många olika roller hos oss och vill erbjuda dig ett meningsfullt jobb där du får möjlighet att bidra till samhället och samtidigt känna glädje. Som medarbetare hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas och sätta avtryck på riktigt.
   

  

 Som anställd i Södertälje kommun erbjuds du bl.a. trygga anställningsvillkor, ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag samt möjlighet att byta semesterdagstillägget mot extra lediga dagar. Inom vissa verksamheter finns även möjlighet till viss flexibilitet avseende arbetstid och arbetsformer. Vi har ett stort utbud av utbildningar och kompetenshöjande insatser för dig som medarbetare. För mer detaljerad information kring våra förmåner läs gärna mer på vår externa hemsida:
   

  

 https://www.sodertalje.se/formaner
   

  

 På Utbildningskontoret erbjuder vi dig även:
   

  

  

* ett viktigt och meningsfullt uppdrag att stödja barn och elever i deras utbildningsresa,
* en stimulerande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att påverka hur vi ska arbeta med framtidens IT-lösningar,
* en möjlighet att få en god balans mellan privat- och arbetsliv,
* ett flexibelt arbetssätt där du kan arbeta på distans två dagar i veckan.


 Utbildningskontoret har totalt 3500 medarbetare och består av på verksamheter inom förskola, grundskola, gymnasiet och utbildning för vuxna med flera olika skolformer och stödprocesser.
   

  

 Rollen ingår i verksamhetsområdet Strategi- och verksamhetsstöd inom enheten UK administration som innehåller olika stödprocesser. Inom det verksamhetsnära IT arbetet finns utöver den här rollen, 3 systemförvaltare och en lösningsarkitekt.
   

  

 Befattningen ska även samverka inom den kommungemensamma IT-funktionen, som ansvarar för basplattan.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en heltidsanställning med placering på Utbildningskontoret i Södertälje.
   

  

**Välkommen till oss!**
 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt Säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning.
   

  

 För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**About Kambi**
 Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
   

  

 Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
   

  

 With offices in Malta (HQ), Philadelphia, London, Bucharest, Manila, Sydney, Uppsala and Stockholm we are +950 passionate and highly skilled people working at Kambi. We believe in a diverse and flexible environment. Our core values are: Better, Faster, Together.
   

  

 These core values are reflected throughout our whole organization as well as towards our partners. We strive to have a diverse work environment as we believe it makes us a strong organization.
   

  

**The Role**
* We are looking for an Engineering Manager to further strengthen our development teams' ability to provide the highest value possible to our partners. Kambi are strong believers of self-organized teams, and as an Engineering Manager you manage two to three cross-functional DevOps teams.
* You will be guiding and empowering teams, fostering continuous improvement, and enhancing skills through consistent one-on-one meetings, effective performance development, and dedicated coaching. You will support your teams in cross-team communications and foster an open and collaborative culture between teams.
* Aside from working with your teams you will also have a responsibility of continuously improve work throughout the Engineering organization. You will together with other Engineering Managers, be a driving force in evolving Kambi’s development organization to grow in parallel with Kambi global strategy.
* To fit well into our teams, you should have a curious mindset and an energetic approach which inspires and engages colleagues and collaborators to achieve, deliver and own their work. To succeed in the role, we believe you have worked as a manager for at least 2 years with development teams and you have both theoretical and practical knowledge of agile and/or lean software principles. You are a passionate leader dedicated to empowering individuals and teams, fostering growth, and unlocking potential, with a strong desire to contribute to a thriving, fast-growing company.
* At Kambi we believe in the importance of work-life-balance and making that culture part of our day-to-day. We believe that you as well as Kambi benefit from having happy, healthy colleagues.
* You will be based in our Stockholm office with a hybrid work setup, working in a team together with other Engineering Managers, reporting to Head of Development. As we are an international and multinational company, our main language is English.


**What’s in it for you?**
 An opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing, international company. We operate in AWS cloud and DevOps teams, and we can offer an exciting environment where you can grow and learn.
   

  

 You will join a dedicated team where you will be able to directly influence the work environment and processes. We also believe in an encouraging environment, and we embrace diversity.
   

  

 At Kambi, we encourage learning and provide opportunities for our team members to develop their skills and knowledge. We offer internal trainings, participation in industry conferences and other collaborative events. We believe that the best way to achieve our mission is to foster a culture of continuous learning and development.
   

  

 We are curious about your story, if you are interested in meeting us, please apply with your CV.
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

**Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace**
 If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.
   

  

**Creating an inclusive environment**
 We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.
   

  

 #wearekambi

 Our innovative Exonaut® platform empowers capability development, building on key insights for when it matters the most. title: Gaming - Backend Engineering Team Lead
description:
**THE WOW** 
  


 As a Gaming Team Lead at Betsson Group, you will lead a team of talented people andtake overall responsibility for team performance. As the Team Lead, you will take an active rolein driving the delivery of your team and promoting a healthy team spirit and culture. You will also ensure each individual in the team is given the platform to succeed and a high level of support in their career development. Our ethos is that to effectively lead a team, you need to actively participate in its activities, and therefore you will be expected to be a hands-on members of your team.
 


  


  
 


  

  


  
 


  

 What we are looking for
   

  
* Experience in software development for more than 5 years
  
* At least 1 year of management experience
  
* At least 3 years of experience working with Agile methodology
  
* Strong leadership and communication skills
  
* Agile mindset, business goals orientation
  
* Excellent knowledge and experience in C#, .NET Framework, .NET Core, and ASP.NET (Core, MVC, WebAPI)
  


  

 A taster of what you will be involved with
   

  
* People management, including motivation, taking part in recruiting and onboarding, performance reviews, personal development planning and 1-to-1
  
* Close communication with POs, Architects and stakeholders to discuss and implement business requirements
  
* Product development to meet business’s needs and implement components according to the modern software development environment (cloud-based platforms, microservice architecture, etc.)
  
* Proactive position in solution development, processes improvements
  
* Taking part in the decision-making process in design or improvement of application architecture, solution development, architecture and code review
  
* Suggesting technology or approach or solution, discuss it together with the team and decide which technology to use
  
* Our teams are cross-functional and all team members focus on not only doing their own tasks but also work together with and assist other team members
  


  

 What does our tech stack look like?
   


 At Betsson, we pride ourselves on adaptability and keeping up with the latest technologies. Our current tech stack looks like this
 


  

 Frontend
   

  
* Angular 11+, Angular Material (Desktop)
  
* TypeScript 4+, Redux Pattern for State Management
  
* RxJS, Sass
  
* HTML5; and the frontend consumes RESTful APIs and Web Sockets
  
* AWS, Kubernetes, Docker
  


  

 Backend
   

  
* .NET C#, .NET Core, Specflow
  
* .NET Core Web API, .NET Web API
  
* AWS, Kubernetes, Docker
  
* PostgreSQL, MSSQL, Redis, Couchbase
  
* Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ
  
* GitHub, TeamCity
  


  

  

 What we offer
   


 Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 


  


 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
 


  

 Challenge Accepted? 
   


 If you are interested to learn more, please apply with your CV.
 


  


 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our employees are talking about
 


  


 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: Customer Success Manager
job_function: Project Management, Customer Service, and Business Development
description:
We are looking for a motivated Customer Success Manager to join our Customers and Markets unit in Stockholm, Sweden. In this pivotal role, you will cultivate and sustain robust relationships with our Scandinavian key accounts, ensuring their business needs are not only met but exceeded, with a particular focus on the Swedish market. As the face of Virta to our customers, you will facilitate seamless collaboration and consistently deliver value to their businesses.
 



  





  





**You** 
 r
 **Role** 



* Drive business growth: Enhance customer experience and boost customer engagement to fuel our business expansion.
* Lead customer journeys: Take charge of guiding customers through the onboarding process to project delivery and resolution.
* Provide exceptional support: Offer proactive and reactive technical support, troubleshoot issues, and guide customers through complex scenarios related to our charging platform.
* Collaboration: Work closely with Customer Support, Sales, Product Management, and Marketing to achieve outstanding results.
* Maintain orderly processes: Ensure workflows and processes are organized and efficient.
* Be the customer's voice: Provide internal feedback to help us improve and better serve our customers.
* Champion customer success: Partner with customers to maximize the value of our products and services, helping them achieve their goals and become advocates for Virta.



  





**What You Bring** 



* Over 2 years of experience in customer success, account management, or another client-facing role, preferably in the technology sector.
* Strong project management skills, technical acumen, and a solution-oriented mindset.
* Excellent organizational and planning skills with the ability to prioritize effectively.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
* A growth mindset and a passion for continuous learning.
* Strong analytical skills.
* A degree in IT or Business.
* Current residence within the EU.
* Understanding of modern service development (Agile, Scrum) is an advantage.



  





**W** 
 h
 **at We Offer** 




 Join us and become part of a dynamic, fast-growing company in the thriving EV sector. You'll have the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse team of talented individuals from over 30 countries, enriching your professional experience and broadening your perspectives. At Virta, your success is our priority. We are committed to supporting your growth through our comprehensive online Virta Academy. Enjoy the benefits of flexible working hours and a hybrid work model, tailored to meet the needs of both our business and our valued customers.
 



  





**Join Us!** 




 Interested? Please apply by sending your CV & cover letter. We are looking forward to fulfilling this position fast!
 



  





**Facts & Figures about Virta** 



* Virta is Europe’s fastest growing electric vehicle charging platform
* One of the leading global EV charging platforms and charging networks in Europe
* Virta is among the rare 65 companies that made the FT 1000 list four consecutive times
* 30+ countries with charging networks on the Virta platform
* Headquarters: Helsinki, Finland
* Offices: Berlin, Stockholm, Paris, London, Singapore, Bucharest
* 200+ employees
* 500 000+ charging points in the roaming network

title: Business Support : Cisco Services och Software Purchase
description:
Vill du arbeta i en dynamisk och framåtlutad miljö där du får möjlighet att utveckla och optimera inköpsprocesser? Vi söker en engagerad och affärsdriven inköpare med fokus på Cisco Services & Software. Här får du chansen att arbeta i en spännande bransch där det innovativa tempot är högt och bidra till att säkerställa effektiva och lönsamma inköp.
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Vi kallar rollen
 **Business Support** 
 och du kommer vara en nyckelspelare när det gäller inköp av Cisco Services & Software. Du kommer supporta affären med offertunderlag och olika rapporter och fungera som Contract Asset Manager för några av våra kunder. Du samarbetar nära säljspecialister andra i vår Cisco-affär och bygger starka relationer med både säljare, partners och kunder. Rollen ligger under Atea Technical Services, som är en del av affärsområdet
 *Atea Software Cloud & Services* 
 .
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter i rollen som Business Support** 



* Utarbeta offerter och prisförslag för våra säljare och kollegor på inom Cisco support och mjukvara.
* Anskaffa support genom Ciscos system.
* Säkerställa att inköpsunderlag är korrekta och att informationen registreras korrekt i våra interna system.
* Assistera med att ta fram olika rapporter för våra säljare inom olika uppdrag.
* Fungera som Contract Asset Manager för vissa av våra kunder.
* Hantera leverantörsfakturor på en grundläggande nivå.
* Hantera och analysera inköpsdata för att optimera affären.



  





**Vem är du?** 




 För att få bästa förutsättningar i rollen så besitter du flera av dessa egenskaper och kunskaper
 


* Strukturerad och noggrann.
* Stresstålig, då arbetet snabbt kan växla i uppgift och arbetsbelastning.
* Van att arbeta med Excel som arbetsverktyg.
* Du har god analytisk förmåga och ett affärsmässigt mindset.
* Du är noggrann och lämnar inte saken åt slumpen.
* Du har förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Du är kommunikativ och relationsskapande med god samarbetsförmåga.
* Prestigelös och ödmjuk, med en vilja att lära sig och dela kunskap.
* Du är flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.



  





**Om Atea** 




 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av IT-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.
 



  





 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" - en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
 



  





**Har vi väckt ditt intresse?** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Stefan Claesson, Head of Customer Success & Technical Services, via stefan.claesson@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!
 



  





 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
 



  





 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
 



  





 Vi hoppas på att få se din ansökan!
 



**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: New Business Development Manager | Remote
description:
We are looking for someone who is a high achiever and knows how to create new business, is excited by it, and can self manage and work autonomously.
 



  





 Company Description
 



 Brilliant Unstoppable You empowers individuals to unlock their full potential through immersive online courses and transformational destination events. Our programs are designed to foster mindset shifts, emotional state balance, identity shifts, personal breakthroughs, and lasting growth. Join us on a journey to thrive in life and achieve your highest and most fulfilling potential.
 



  





 Role Description
