 This is a remote role for a New Business Development Manager, located in Sweden.
 



  





 The New Business Development Manager will be responsible for:
 


* generating new business, new clients
* helping clients with onboarding and growth
* driving revenue growth



  





 Day-to-day tasks include:
 


* advertising research
* developing and executing strategies to find new clients
* lead generation
* appointment setting
* delivering presentations to potential clients and looking after their needs



  





 Qualifications:
 


* Experience with advertising and New Business Development
* Presentation and Communication skills
* Proven track record in driving revenue growth
* Ability to work independently
* Experience in the education industry is a plus



  





 Conditions:
 


* this is a remote role
* you must be able to work autonomously and self manage
* you will be remunerated for new business generated
* Not suitable for students or interns

title: Fleet Manager
description:
**Are you ready for a leadership role with great rewards? Would you like to be responsible for the safe and efficient operation of 47 boats.** 




  





 On behalf of Strömma Turism & Sjöfart AB, MARPRO Group is looking for a Fleet Manager for the office in Stockholm. You will report to the COO of the company.
 



  





**The job** 




 Strömma Turism & Sjöfart AB is looking for a Fleet Manager to oversee the operation, maintenance, and compliance of forty-seven vessels and three workshops in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö. The role includes leading technical teams, managing maintenance plans, ensuring safety and quality standards, handling budgets, procurement, and reporting. Responsibilities also cover work environment compliance, system management for maintenance and documentation, and on-call duties. Strong leadership, technical problem-solving, and planning skills are essential for success in this role.
 



  





**Professional qualifications** 



* A maritime education like Marine Engineer, Naval Architect or Project manager
* Maritime regulatory knowledge with specific Swedish national regulation
* Technical problem-solving
* Strong ability to plan, allocate resources, and lead teams
* Financial & technical reporting
* Budget management
* Procurement & supplier management
* System responsibility
* Software Proficiency and IT savvy– competency in Microsoft Office Suite
* Language skills – fluent in Swedish and English



  





**Personal characteristics** 




 This role requires a leader who thrives in a fast-paced maritime environment, balancing technical expertise, team leadership, and operational efficiency to ensure smooth and safe fleet operations.
 



 A successful Fleet Manager at Strömma Turism should possess a combination of strong leadership skills, technical expertise, and the ability to manage complex operations under pressure. The ideal candidate will have the following personal characteristics:
 



  




* Strong communicator
* Service-oriented mindset
* Decisive under pressure
* Strategic thinker
* Detail-oriented
* Strong leadership and delegation
* Proactive problem-solver
* Collaborative and team-oriented
* Adaptable and flexible



  





**Strömma Turism & Sjöfart AB offers** 



* Competitive salary in a challenging environment
* 24/7 On-duty 500 SEK/day
* Leisure allowance: 3000 SEK



  





**Application** 




 The application process is handled by MARPRO Group. If you have any questions to this position, please contact MARPRO Group at +45 5370 0995.
 



  





 If you are interested in the position, please upload a motivated application and an updated CV via the application button. You will receive a confirmation email from us. Please check your spam folder, if you have not received the confirmation within 10 minutes after applying, to ensure future communication.
 



  





***About Strömma Turism & Sjöfart AB***




*Strömma is the leading provider of sightseeing, dining cruises, and unique experiences in Northern Europe. Strömma has a history dating back to 1809 and offers unforgettable boat and bus tours in Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, and the Netherlands. Through Strömma's experiences of history, culture, nature, and sustainable tourism, memories for life are created.*

title: Business Development Manager
description:
The payments market is the most exciting technology market in the world today for good reason. McKinsey values it globally at over $2 trillion and it’s growing between 13-15% year-on-year. Some of the largest most dynamic brands are investing in this sector; Apple has ApplePay, Google has GooglePay, Amazon has AmazonPay, and it’s not just the Silicon Valley brands. Tencent owns WeChatPay, Alibaba owns Alipay and digital disruptors like Square, Stripe and Adyen all invest millions to grow the payments market.
   

  

 Planet are a technology company that’s transforming payments by putting the customer experience first. We help our customers deliver a better experience for guests, shoppers, and consumers everywhere. We operate in a market that continues to evolve and expand, partnering with the world’s most prestigious brands across Retail and Hospitality, and with a network of Financial Services partners worldwide.
   

  

 To meet consumer demands, payments must be simple, safe, and invisible. The only way to do this is to fully embed payments in the software and networks that runs business. By combining networks, software and payment technology, Planet’s creating a world of connected commerce, that makes payments feel good.
   

  

 We’re growing organically, and with strong Private Equity investors, Advent International and Eurazeo, we’ve the financial capital and expertise to grow our capabilities and reach through acquisition.
   

  

**Sales, Hospitality Overview**
 Hotels are at the forefront in a world where digital and physical experiences are coming together. Planet is excited about helping hotels help their staff and customers towards frictionless processes and experiences, with payment right in the middle.
   

  

 Our Sales Hospitality team comprises of 150 employees globally and with the acquisition of Protel PMS, Hoist groups as well as Avantio, we are just getting started to provide a real feel good, connected experience at world's most well-known hotels.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 We are seeking a motivated and dynamic individual to join our sales team as a Business Development Manager. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing sales activities within a specific, regionally defined area. Key responsibilities include all tasks related to customer relationship management, such as proposal creation, product presentations, and the development and implementation of an individual sales strategy within your designated market. The primary objectives of the Business Development Manager are to:
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Expand and secure the company's market position within the designated sales territory
* Take sales responsibility for specific postal code areas in terms of acquiring new customers
* Actively upsell Planet products to new and assigned customer base
* Conduct contract negotiations
* Plan and conduct product presentations on-site or remotely for prospects and existing customers
* Provide advice on our products and new developments to prospects
* Independently handle written and telephone correspondence within the scope of duties
* Prepare and follow up on offers
* Serve as a point of contact for customer inquiries regarding offers, contracts, and products
* Liaise with other departments and our sales partners
* Support and participate in industry-specific events, trade fairs, and marketing activities
* Maintain sustainable personal customer relationships
* Serve as a contact person for customers regarding cross-departmental customer interests
* Monitor competitors
* Gather customer feedback and conduct market research


**Who You Are**
* Proven experience in sales or business development within the hotel technology landscape
* Strong communication and negotiation skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Native Swedish language skills and proficiency in English required
* Knowledge of the Nordic market is a plus
* Willingness to travel within the designated sales territory
* Experience with Protel is a plus


 Planet is an equal opportunity employer where diversity is valued, and all employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.
   

  

 Come and grow your career in the most exciting, fast paced technology market, with a business that delivers feel-good connected commerce

title: ERP Program- & Project Manager
job_function: Project Management, Information Technology, and Consulting
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and IT System Data Services
description:
**Vill du ta dig an utvecklande uppdrag tillsammans med branschens mest erfarna?** 




  





 Midagon är en nordisk, oberoende verksamhets- och IT-konsultfirma specialiserad på att genomföra utmanande transformationsprojekt och program. Vi är över 200 anställda i Norden, varav närmare 100 befinner sig i Sverige. Vi driver uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor, åt stora globala aktörer såväl som nationella företag. Våra uppdrag varierar i storlek, men gemensamt är att vi hjälper våra kunder att lyckas med sina komplexa transformationer, där vi kan stoltsera med långa kundrelationer samt flertalet egna ramavtal.
 



  





 Våra erfarna konsulter har en bakgrund inom ERP området med fokus på bland annat verksamhetsutveckling, projekt- & programledning eller specialkompetens inom specifika ämnesområden. Hos oss hittar du de bästa av de bästa. Ett ypperligt kvitto är våra utmärkelser som DI Gasellföretag, Sveriges nöjdaste kunder (Radar), 8 års certifiering av ”Great place to work” samt Superföretag av Veckans affärer.
 



  





 Vill du också vara del av ett team av seniora konsulter, där avslappnad atmosfär går hand i hand med ett engagerat arbete och sund livsbalans?
 



  





**Rollen** 




 I denna roll leder du komplexa transformationsprojekt i nära samarbete med våra eller kundens projektledare och verksamhetsutvecklare. Du stöttar kunden genom hela förändringsresan – från tidig projektstart och förstudie till implementering och överlämning. Med din expertis fungerar du som en oberoende rådgivare och bidrar till att kunden når sina affärsmål och står väl rustad för framtida utmaningar.
 



  





 Internt på Midagon blir du en del av ett team av seniora konsulter med djup erfarenhet inom ERP-området - inom exempelvis tillverkande industri, supply chain och ekonomi. Teamet besitter bred kompetens och erfarenhet från både olika roller och systemleverantörer, där samarbete och kunskapsutbyte är centrala delar av arbetet.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 




 · Har mångårig konsulterfarenhet
 



 · Har lett projekt inom affärs- och IT-transformationer inom ERP-program, M&A, verksamhetsarkitektur eller industriella digitaliseringsprojekt
 



 · Är insatt i flera ledande ERP-system som SAP, M3, IFS eller Dynamics
 



 · Kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska
 



  





 För att trivas hos oss krävs kombination av entusiasm, pragmatism samt ett metodist tillvägagångssätt. Både ledarskaps- och projektledningserfarenhet är avgörande, liksom färdigheter inom förändringsledning.
 



 Om du brinner för ständig förändring, älskar att ta dig an komplexa utmaningar och genuint vill hjälpa kunder att realisera sina mål, då kan du vara rätt person för oss.
 



  





**Är du nyfiken?** 




 Läs gärna mer om oss och Våra tidigare uppdrag, på hemsidan kan du också enkelt registrerar din ansökan. Har du ytterligare frågor eller funderingar, tveka inte att kontakta Martin Nilsson inom HR-& rekrytering på martin.nilsson@midagon.com / 070-2257833 eller vår Head of people and culture, Hanna Fredriksson på hanna.fredriksson@midagon.com / 076-0074551.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: SAP Sourcing & Procurement consultant
description:
Do you have a passion for transforming businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Then our roles as SAP Sourcing & Procurement consultant in our SAP Business Group are a perfect find for you!
   

  

 Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!
   

  

**About Our Nordic SAP Business Group**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic and Global SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP S/4 HANA driven business transformation programs with several of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, Ariba, Icertis, SAP BTP and SAP RISE. Our proven delivery methods inclde preconfigured industry template and embrace new capabilities introduced by AI .
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking at experienced candidates for several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**What’s in it for you:**
- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.

- Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.

- Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.

- Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert network and benchmarks.

- A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.

- Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.

- Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP, by analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.

- Utilize your Industry expertise in the field of SAP solutions to deliver client value as a professional individual and as part of a team.

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery.

- Competitive compensation and benefits.

- Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.

- Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP Smart Procurement Value Tower and contribute to thought leadership, competence development, and sales initiatives.

**SAP Smart Procurement Nordic Value Tower**
 The sourcing & procurement function is shifting. Traditionally driven and managed by deep and complex processes, their future must become digital, data driven and automated. Helping our clients to succeed in this transformation journey is what we thrive for.
   

  

 SAP Smart Procurement Value Tower is one out of 10 different process specialization communities within our Nordic SAP Business Group.
   

  

 We work hand in hand with our procurement strategy colleagues and our global delivery centers.
   

  

 Our cross-Nordics team designs and configure sourcing & procurement processes in S/4 HANA, Ariba upstream and downstream processes and Fieldglass - and we excel both in large, global S/4 HANA engagements (from smart brownfield through full business transformations) as well as in more focused multi-step process capability deployments.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
- Min. 3 years of hands-on SAP S/4 HANA sourcing & procurement experience as consultant from at least two S/4HANA projects (preferably in the Nordics)

- Based in Nordics or EU, with either EU citizenship or valid work permit

- Good understanding of sourcing and procurement business processes and their key value drivers

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Motivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellence

- Passionate about SAP, innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Effectively work with cross-functional teams/stakeholders in an international and fast-moving environment

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility, and team player

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source, and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

- We recruit at different levels. For manager level and above, we would like you to have:

- at least 7 years of relevant project experience as well as

- having led a team

- demonstrating leadership skills, and ideally also

- some earlier involvement in the acquisition of new projects (business development).

**Preferred Qualifications**
- Experience of the full S/4 project lifecycle including estimating, planning, and delivering a solution end-to-end

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken

- An SAP certification in relevant area

- Ariba experience in addition to S/4 HANA configuration

- Deep business & industry experience in one or more industries

**Location**
 Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö
   

  

**Does this appeal to you?**
 If so, we really wish to hear from you! (We need people who can challenge conventional wisdom, offer unique perspectives, and contribute with innovative solutions.)
   

  

*If you are interested to learn more about Accenture´s recruitment process, great! We have gathered more info for you* 
*here.*
 Pleasenote that due to the summer season, our hiring process may be slower than usual. We apologize for any delay in responding to your applications. Rest assured, we are committed to reviewing each application thoroughly. We appreciate your patience during this time.

title: Kommunikatör (Stockholm, DE, 117 61)
description:
*Är du en kreativ kommunikatör med passion för strategisk och operativ kommunikation? Letar du efter en flexibel deltidsroll där du får vara med och lyfta ett internationellt bolags varumärke samtidigt som du skapar engagerande innehåll? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig!*
**Din framtida roll**
 Nu söker vi en engagerad och självgående kommunikatör till vårt kontor i Stockholm. Som kommunikatör på Implenia har du hand om intern-, likväl som extern kommunikation och du säkerställer att varumärket representeras enhetligt i våra olika projekt, gentemot koncernen och för externa intressenter. Dina arbetsdagar är varierande - du kommer ha en viktig roll i arbetet med att lyfta och sprida allt spännande som händer i vår verksamhet samtidigt som du axlar arbetet att höja varumärkeskännedomen för Implenia både som bolag och arbetsgivare.
   

  

 Du kommer att jobba tillsammans med övriga enheter inom Implenia, men även tillsammans med externa parter som vi samarbetar med. Du blir en del av teamet ”Project Excellence and Services” som idag består av ett team om tio personer som bland annat jobbar med hållbarhet, arbetsmiljö, kvalitet, IT och kommunikation.
   

  

**Du Kommer Bland Annat Jobba Med**
* Skapa engagerande innehåll i form av text, video, bild och ljud till våra olika kanaler
* Skriva, granska och hantera texter
* Bistå olika team och interna grupper med din språkliga expertis
* Planera, genomföra och följa upp kommunikationsaktiviteter och våra digitala kanaler (inkl. sociala medier)
* Vara med och utveckla vårt sätt att kommunicera internt och på sikt hitta nya kommunikationssätt
* Samarbeta över organisationsgränser med olika typer av kommunikationsfrågor, även internationellt med kollegorna i koncernen


**Är du den vi söker?**
 Vi söker dig som är självständig i ditt arbete, social, nyfiken och trivs med att ha många kontaktytor. Som person är du ansvarstagande och noggrann, tar egna initiativ och är bekväm med att fatta egna beslut och lösa utmaningar varefter de uppstår. Vidare ser vi att du besitter en god kommunikativ förmåga (på både svenska och engelska) för att kunna förmedla information om vår verksamhet på ett tydligt, förståeligt och intressant sätt.
   

  

 För att trivas hos oss har du ett prestigelöst förhållningssätt till såväl stora som små uppgifter. Vi ser gärna att du har arbetat några år som kommunikatör, har en utbildning med inriktning media- och kommunikation och ett öga för grafisk design och filmskapande. Du har goda språkkunskaper och är en obehindrad användare i Adobe Creative Suites. Vidare är det meriterande om du har tidigare vana att arbeta i SharePoint och Storykit. B-körkort är ett krav.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Som en del av Implenia kan du förvänta dig ett varierande arbete med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter. Du blir en del av en organisation där du får frihet under eget ansvar samtidigt som du har positiva och samarbetsvilliga kollegor att växa och kompetensutvecklas med. Våra medarbetare är vår främsta styrka och det är viktigt att alla känner sig trygga hos oss och trivs på jobbet. På Implenia värderar vi mångfald, vår rekryteringsprocess är därför inriktad på att främja jämställdhet och inkludering.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en deltidsanställning på 50% och inleds med en provanställning på 6 månader. Vi välkomnar även konsultlösningar via egen verksamhet.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Implenia Sverige AB har närmare 450 anställda och många års erfarenhet och kompetens inom utmanande och multidisciplinära infrastrukturprojekt. Vi är rikstäckande med projekt över hela Sverige och våra kontor är belägna i Stockholm och Göteborg. Implenia Sverige AB är en del av Implenia Group, som är den ledande leverantören av byggtjänster i Schweiz och är etablerade i flertalet europeiska länder.
   

  

*Låter det som en spännande möjlighet för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag och bli en del av kommunikationsteamet på Implenia!*
 Vid frågor kontakta HR Generalist Nina Cakarevic - nina.cakarevic@implenia.com

title: Infrastrukturspecialist – Klient
description:
IT
   

  

 Infrastrukturspecialist – Klient
   

  

 Nu söker enheten för it och digital utveckling en engagerad och analytisk person för tjänsten som Infrastrukturspecialist inom området Klientplattform, med en stark vilja att utveckla och ta ansvar för tjänsterna inom objektområdet.
   

  

 Enheten för it och digital utveckling, som är en del av kommunledningskontoret, har uppdraget att styra, stödja och driva på kommunens utvecklingsarbete med stöd av it. Inom enheten finns kommunens samlade it-infrastruktur, systemförvaltning, utvecklingsstöd samt användarstöd och support.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Rollen som infrastrukturspecialist inom klientplattform erbjuder en spännande och varierad arbetsvardag med stort eget ansvar. Här blir du en nyckelspelare i drift, förvaltning och säkerhetsuppföljning av Täbys tjänster inom Klientplattform. Du samarbetar med andra IT-specialister för att analysera support- och driftstörningar, implementera nya konfigurationer och bidra till framgångsrika projekt och uppdrag. Vi söker dig som har djupa kunskaper i hantering av klientutrustning, samt erfarenhet av Active Directory och Microsoft 365. I rollen har du huvudsakligt ansvar för ett objekt men din breda erfarenhet och kompetens gör dig till en viktig del av teamets samlade expertis.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du har ett stort IT-intresse och brinner för att leverera hög service. Du trivs i samarbeten och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap, både inom teamet och organisationen. Som person är du serviceinriktad, lösningsorienterad och strukturerad, med förmågan att arbeta självständigt och driva ditt arbete framåt. Du är analytisk, nyfiken och har en god förståelse för samband och helhetsperspektiv.
   

  

 För rollen krävs körkort samt goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift. Du har teknisk kompetens inom klienthantering och gärna erfarenhet av IT-support och second line.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi även att du har följande kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Lägst 3-årig gymnasieutbildning eller annan adekvat eftergymnasial utbildning
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att arbeta inom klientobjektet med fokus på drift och utveckling/design av tjänsterna.
* Erfarenhet av ansvar för it tekniska tjänster och tjänsteleveranser
* Mycket god kunskap om Användarhantering via Active Directory och EntraID
* Mycket god kunskap om Intune, Defender 365 och SCCM portaler och verktyg
* Mycket god kunskap om Windows operativsystem


 Det är även meriterande om du innehar några eller någon av följande erfarenhet:
   

  

* Managering, support och felsökning av Chromebooks via Google Cloud
* Mobila enheter smartphones, surfplattor via Intune
* Applikationspaketering ex med hjälp av Installshield
* Policyhantering (GPO) via EntraID och AD för olika objekt
* Powershell script
* Management verktyget Jamf för AppleTv
* Tidigare dokumenterad erfarenhet från IT support, Second Line med inriktning Klient


 Om verksamheten
   

  

 Täby är en av Sveriges mest välskötta kommuner med stor valfrihet, välfärdstjänster av hög kvalitet, attraktivt näringslivsklimat och stabil ekonomi. Skolorna i kommunen uppvisar toppresultat, förskolorna erbjuder en trygg och stimulerande miljö och vid kommunens äldreboenden är nöjdheten stor. Läget är attraktivt med närhet till både Stockholm och Arlanda, samtidigt som tillgången till skog, hav och strövområden ger möjlighet till naturupplevelser och rekreation.
   

  

 Täby utvecklas med nya attraktiva och trygga miljöer och genom att befintliga områden vidareutvecklas – hållbart, med omsorg om kulturarv och där större sammanhängande grönområden värnas. Halva Täby ska vara grönt och hela Täby hållbart. Trafik och infrastruktur ska fungera i vardagen och utvecklas för framtiden.
   

  

 På kommunledningskontoret finns de centrala ledningsresurserna och det administrativa stödet till kommunens verksamhetsområden som till exempel ekonomi, utredning, HR och kommunikation. Vi samordnar och driver övergripande utveckling och ansvarar för strategier, riktlinjer och verktyg.
   

  

 Tjänsten är inplacerad i säkerhetsklass. Det innebär att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen före anställning. Innan en eventuell anställning i Täby kommun ombeds du som kandidat även verifiera relevanta utbildningar och arbetslivserfarenhet samt uppvisa ett utdrag ur Polisens belastningsregister ”Utdrag från belastningsregistret för enskild person enligt 9
   

  

* 1 stycket lagen (1998:620) om belastningsregister”. Utdraget ska uppvisas i obrutet kuvert och går att beställa på Polisens hemsida Kontrollera egna uppgifter, e-tjänst | Polismyndigheten (polisen.se). För tjänsten krävs svenskt medborgarskap och du kan komma att ingå i kommunens organisation för tjänsteperson i beredskap. Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas. Arbetstiden är mellan kl 08-16:20, flextid mellan 06 och 21 om arbetet tillåter. I huvudsak mellan 07:30 och 17:00. Andra tider och kvällsarbete kan komma att bli aktuellt vid särskilda insatser, samt vid större leverans- eller förändringsarbeten. Beredskap utanför arbetstid enligt schema ingår i tjänsten.


 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med start enligt överenskommelse. Rekryteringen kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, så skicka in ditt CV redan idag. Rekryteringen sker i samarbete med Poolia och du är välkommen att höra av dig till Jennifer Nilsson för frågor. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Executive Assistant CFO to Securitas AB
company: The Pace - en del av Wise Professionals
description:
Are you a structured and proactive professional who thrives in a role with significant responsibility? Do you have experience working closely with senior management and enjoy creating organization and efficiency in a dynamic environment? This is your opportunity to become a key player in Securitas' finance department as Executive Assistant to the CFO. If you are detail-oriented, solution-driven, and comfortable in an international, business-oriented setting, this could be the perfect role for you!
   

  

 Securitas is looking for an Executive Assistant who will play a key role in supporting the CFO and the finance department. This is a position for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, handling everything from daily administration to coordinating strategic processes.
   

  

 This is a direct hire position based at Securitas’ headquarters in Stockholm, with a planned start in early or mid-June.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Executive Assistant to the CFO, you will be an integral part of the finance organization with a broad and varied role. You will be responsible for calendar and travel management, coordinating important meetings and processes, and serving as a key contact for both internal and external stakeholders. You will also prepare and oversee the annual financial control and business planning processes, as well as coordinate work related to the audit committee.
   

  

**Some Of Your Key Responsibilities Will Include**
* Administration & Coordination – Manage the CFO’s calendar, travel arrangements, and expense handling, while serving as a key contact for internal and external stakeholders.
* Meetings & Planning – Plan and coordinate business planning meetings, financial control processes, and audit committee work, ensuring an effective meeting structure.
* HR & Internal Communication – Support onboarding, vacation planning, and internal communication initiatives in collaboration with Group Communications.


**Your Background**
 To succeed as an Executive Assistant, we expect you to have several years of experience in a similar role, preferably at board or executive level. Experience in an international and publicly listed company or a finance environment with a strong understanding of numbers is a plus.
   

  

 You have excellent communication skills and are fluent in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written. Integrity and reliability are second nature to you, and you are accustomed to working at a high level, ensuring quality in everything you do. You are results-oriented, detail-focused, and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, adjusting priorities flexibly while working in a structured manner under tight deadlines.
   

  

 Furthermore, you have a proactive approach, always staying one step ahead. You have an eye for detail and take pride in going the extra mile to create a positive work environment for those around you. You value relationships and are motivated by your drive to assist others.
   

  

 As the role involves project and process coordination, you must be able to work in a structured and efficient manner. You have strong IT skills, particularly in Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, and can quickly adapt to new systems.
   

  

**About Securitas**
 Securitas is one of the world’s leading providers of security solutions and has been a driving force in the industry since 1934. With nearly 10,000 employees in Sweden and operations in 44 countries, we work to protect homes, workplaces, and communities.
   

  

 At Securitas, you will work in a dynamic, business-oriented environment alongside ambitious colleagues in a fast-paced setting. Our company culture is built on collaboration and engagement, and as an Executive Assistant, you will be part of a tight-knit community of other executive assistants within the company. Our headquarters fosters an open and inclusive atmosphere, with key functions located on the same floor, creating a close-knit and efficient work environment with short decision-making processes.
   

  

 Our core values – Integrity, Vigilance, and Helpfulness – guide our daily interactions with clients, colleagues, and society at large.
   

  

**Application**
 Securitas AB is partnering with Wise Professionals, The Pace for this recruitment. To ensure an objective and non-discriminatory selection process, candidates advancing in the process will complete occupational psychological assessments.
   

  

 For questions about the position, please contact Emma Rehn (emma.rehn@wise.se) or Philip Alfredsson (philip.alfredsson@thepace.se). We review applications continuously, and the position may be filled before the final application deadline.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: Gruppchef Styrsystem
description:
Är du en erfaren ledare som brinner för systemutveckling, strategiskt arbete och att skapa resultat genom samverkan? Vill du leda ett kompetent team och spela en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av kollektivtrafikens infrastruktur? Då kan det här vara din nästa utmaning!
   

  

**Om oss**
 Hos oss på trafikförvaltningen får du jobba med starka varumärken som SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänst i Region Stockholm och Spårvägsmuseet.
   

  

 Tillsammans ansvarar vi för halva Sveriges kollektivtrafik och vi har höga ambitioner. Vi utvecklar en av världens mest hållbara och attraktiva kollektivtrafik. Och vi jobbar dagligen med att minska vår miljöpåverkan, öka social hållbarhet och ansvarfullt förvalta våra gemensamma medel. Utan oss stannar Stockholm.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi befinner oss i en spännande expansionsfas där vi bygger nya tillgångar inom tunnelbana, spårväg och buss. Som Gruppchef för Styrsystem leder du 11 medarbetare bestående av systemingenjörer, systemspecialister och systemförvaltare som arbetar med att säkerställa driftsäkra och effektiva SCADA-system.
   

  

 I din roll får du möjligheten att påverka och driva förändringsarbetet inom sektionen och bidra till att utveckla en mer proaktiv och styrd arbetsprocess. Du kommer att arbeta nära IT- och investeringsprojektavdelningarna. Du ingår i sektionens ledningsgrupp och rapporterar direkt till sektionschefen.
   

  

**Några exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Leda och utveckla ett team på ca 11 medarbetare och konsulter.
* Säkerställa leveranser, måluppfyllelse och en effektiv budgethantering.
* Driva strategiskt och taktiskt utvecklingsarbete för att stärka vår verksamhet.
* Ansvara för arbetsmiljö, agila arbetssätt och processer.
* Bygga starka relationer internt (med bl.a. IT) och externt (med Förvaltning för utbyggd tunnelbana, FUT) för att skapa framgångsrika och effektiva samarbeten.
* Förändringsleda och utveckla gruppens kompetens inom systemförvaltning och systemutveckling.


**För att trivas och lyckas i rollen behöver du:**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en relationsskapande och resultatinriktad ledare med förmåga att driva förändring och engagera ditt team. Du är kommunikativ, lyhörd och har en strategisk förmåga att se helheten.
   

  

**Krav:**
* Minst två års chefserfarenhet med personal-, ekonomi- och planeringsansvar.
* Erfarenhet av systemförvaltning och systemutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en matrisorganisation.
* Erfarenhet av strategiskt och taktiskt arbete
* God förmåga att kommunicera på svenska i både tal och skrift


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Högskoleutbildning inom IT eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av SCADA-system och driftövervakning.
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning och utvecklingsarbete.
* Erfarenhet av resurs- och/eller projektplanering.


**Det här erbjuder vi dig**
 På trafikförvaltningen har du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas för ett helt yrkesliv. Här kan du vara expert och fokusera på ditt sakområde. Samtidigt som du jobbar i ett lag och i en organisation med stor bredd. Det finns stora möjligheter att röra sig mellan olika roller och uppgifter. Du har utrymme att forma din egen karriärväg och stärka både din personliga och professionella utveckling i en spännande och varierad miljö!
   

  

 Vi är en välkomnande och öppen arbetsplats där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra. Vi vet att nyckeln för att vi ska klara vårt uppdrag – är medarbetare som trivs, mår bra och kan utvecklas på jobbet. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid att säkerställa hållbarhet i vårt arbetssätt, bland annat genom att erbjuda flexibilitet i vardagen och hybridarbete när möjlighet finns.
   

  

 Årligen erbjuds hälsoundersökning och friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr. Hälsospåret, vår friskvårdssatsning, innehåller en rad olika hälsofrämjande aktiviteter. SL-kort är en annan uppskattad förmån hos oss. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Du ansöker med CV via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökan via e-post. För att säkra objektiva bedömningar använder vi tester i samband med urval. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Peter Bianconi, tfn 070-786 39 77. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta rekryterare Ulrika Falk, tfn 08-123 333 68.
   

  

 Ansök redan i dag eftersom intervjuer kan ske löpande. Sista ansökningsdag är
 **8 april** 
 . Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Grundutredning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan komma att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Vissa tjänster ställer krav på svenskt medborgarskap samt omfattas av en säkerhetsprövningsintervju med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas och eventuella arbetsprov kan bli aktuella för tjänsten.
   

  

 Nyckelord: SCADA, driftövervakning, styrsystem, systemförvaltning, systemutveckling
   

  

**Webb och sociala medier**
 För mer information om hur det är att jobba hos oss, besök vår karriärsida. Du hittar oss också på LinkedIn.
   

  

 Vi är stolta samhällsutvecklare. Med kompetens och engagemang tar vi Stockholm och kollektivtrafiken framåt. Vi ansvarar för SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänsten och Spårvägsmuseet och tillsammans utvecklar vi en trygg, attraktiv och tillgänglig kollektivtrafik för nära 900 000 resenärer. Följ med oss på resan!
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/2273 | Kontakt: Ulrika Falk 08-12333368, | Facklig företrädare: Camilla Nyberg, Akavia 08-12331847, Marita Lönnroth, Vision 08-12333992, Thérèse Juvall, Akademikerförbundet SSR 08-12313942, Amir Sokolović, Sveriges ingenjörer 08-12333706, | Publicerat: 2025-03-25 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-08

title: SAP Master Data - Solution Architect
description:
Hi all,
   

  

 We are looking for SAP Master Data - Solution Architect to our reputed customer in Sweden - Stockholm .
   

  

 About ITIVE AB:
   

  

 ITIVE AB, founded in 2019 and headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, is a leading IT consulting firm offering a wide range of customer-centric services. Our offerings include IT staffing and permanent placement, IT management, system development, infrastructure, ERP systems, quality assurance, IT security and Non -IT .
   

  

 Job Overview :
   

  

 The Solution Architect (SA) for Master Data has responsibility for ensuring the timely and fit for purpose design of all elements of the assigned technology capability. He or She is responsible for the solution design and architecture within their technical area and support the functional requirements across business process areas
   

  

* Lead the design and architecture of SAP solutions, ensuring alignment with business goals and best practices within the area of Master Data
* Provide strategic guidance and expertise in SAP, including system configuration, integration and optimization
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze business requirements, translating them into effective SAP solutions
* Oversee the development of detailed solution architectures and ensure the successful deployment of SAP products and guide towards adherence to standard to avoid customizations
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, project managers, SI-partners and business representatives to deliver E2E SAP solutions
* Stay current with industry trends, SAP updates and emerging technologies within his or hers area
* Possess a clear understanding of the interdependencies the assigned process area(s) and other process areas
* Ensure a healthy and stable application portfolio with prioritizing and following up on problem tickets


 Experience level:
   

  

 High level of experience from several similar assignments/projects. Can work independently and to some extent lead a small group and develop within the area.
   

  

 Additional experience:
   

  

* Minimum 4 years of experience working as a SAP Solution Architect or similar role/experience with Master Data being the primary field/expertise
* Proven experience working with relevant modules/areas wrt S/4 Master Data, MDG and CAR (DDF/MDTM)
* In-depth knowledge of SAP architecture for relevant modules, capabilities and best practices wrt Master Data
* Strong understanding of business processes and the ability to align SAP solutions with organizational goals
* SAP certification in relevant modules or S/4 Hana is highly desirable


 Experience with SAP cloud solutions is a plus
   

  

* Experience with tools such as JIRA and Focused Build is a plus
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Comfortable and capable in facilitating workshops and driving decisions


 Education:
   

  

* Higher degree within Engineering, IT or similar field


 If you are a highly motivated and talented individual with a passion for Master Data Architect, we want to hear from you! Join our exciting journey to deliver innovative solutions to our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits packages, as well as opportunities for growth and development within the company.
   

  

 Apply now and take the next step in your career as a SAP Master Data Architect with us.

title: Brand Manager GB Glace
company_industry: Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, and Food and Beverage Services
description:
**Ice cream lover? We are looking for a Brand Manager to GB Glace!**
**Function:** 
 Marketing
   

  

**Scope:** 
 Local
   

  

**Location:** 
 Solna, Sweden
   

  

**Terms & Conditions:** 
 Fixed-term role, estimated until Aug 2026
   

  

****ABOUT US****
 At GB Glace, we believe in spreading joy one scoop at a time! As Sweden's favorite ice cream brand, we are dedicated to creating delicious and innovative ice cream experiences that bring smiles to faces of all ages.
   

  

****JOB DESCRIPTION****
 Are you a creative and passionate marketeer with a love for ice cream? Do you have a knack for branding and a growth mindset? Then this role is tailored for you. GB Glace is looking for an Ice Cream Brand Manager to lead the local impulse singles and multipack portfolio and activation in Sweden.
   

  

****KEY RESPONSIBILITIES****
 You will have responsibility to drive the strategic business and marketing agenda for your portfolio ensuring competitiveness, market leadership and E2E P&L ownership.
   

  

****The Role Includes:****
* Build brand plans based on market insights, consumer and shopper trends, NRM principles, channel insights and competitor understanding.
* Own the long-term portfolio plans and lead local innovation projects including building business cases, drive projects through the innovation process, artwork management and working closely with customer development teams.
* Build and execute brand 360 plans e.g. media, PR, consumer promotions, channel / retail specific marketing programs as well as owning the shopper marketing strategy and execution.
* Analyzing and reporting of your brand’s business results i.e. regular monitoring of performance and innovation tracking to make recommendations and optimizing the portfolio and future plans.
* Lead brand agenda in collaboration with cross functional team (CBD, CMI, central teams).
* Responsible for the allocated media budget incl spend reconciliation and timely vendor payment.
* As a Brand Manager, you will engage with different cross-functional teams and stakeholders across Ice Cream Nordics and establish close collaborations with EU platform teams.


****WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED****
* Entrepreneurial spirit, growth and ‘let’s do it’ mindset – someone who seeks out the opportunities.
* Strong business acumen with a desire for empowerment to develop and build brand plans.
* Good understanding of media principles, strategy and planning.
* Strong analytical skills to utilize data and consumer insights to make informed decisions.
* Strong communication skills to become a brand advocacy.
* Strong P&L and Business Case understanding.
* IT literacy & Nielsen understanding.
* Language requirements English and Swedish.


****RELEVANT EXPERIENCE****
* Master’s degree.
* 2-4 years of brand management experience in an FMCG environment.
* Proven ability as a creative and innovative thinker with experience working effectively in cross-functional teams.
* Must possess excellent analytical abilities and strong project management skills.
* Exhibit a strong bias for action and accountability for both self and others.
* Demonstrated understanding of and experience in digital and social media platforms and technology.
* Excellent written & verbal communication skills.
* Experience with customer facing responsibilities a plus.


****ADDITIONAL INFORMATION****
 This is a parental leave cover and the start date is June 2025, we will proceed with interviews asap. This role will be based in Solna, Sweden. To be taken into consideration for this role, you will need to hold a valid working permit for.
   

  

**ARE YOU EXCITED TO CRAFT GB GLACE FUTURE?**
 Please apply within deadline via application portal. E-mail applications will not be processed. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment journey. Should you require additional information or reasonable adjustments to allow you to present your best self during this process, please contact Nordic TA nordic.ta@unilever.com.
   

  

****ADDITIONAL INFORMATION****
 Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life. This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.
   

  

 Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

title: Product Owner - Identity & Personalization
description:
**Product Owner – Identity & Personalization**
**Electrolux Group:**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 If your values align with following, we will get along! You will be part of a team that place the consumer at heart of everything and your deliveries will have a direct impact on the consumers experiences. Challenge and be challenged is encouraged and fast is better than slow while having trust and a safe space.
   

  

 Join us to create change and have an impact in homes around the world.
   

  

**The Organization and The Role:**
 The Consumer Direct Interaction - Experience Organization (CDI XO) consist of a Digital Commerce and Digital Post Purchase domain with several Product Areas. We are seeking an experienced and motivated Product Owner to join the Consumer Engagement Product Area, delivering cross domains, by setting the strategic direction based on CDI XO vision. The Consumer Engagement Product Area includes Identity & Personalization who is responsible for the
   

  

* Identity strategy that revolves around delivering great login and sign-up consumer experience globally while keeping standardization high and maintenance efficient, enabled by Agile and DevOps practices. The goal is to drive customer retention and satisfaction while managing information about the identity of users and user consent and is a crucial element in maintaining a persistent marketing technology landscape.
* Personalization strategy that revolves around personalizing the experiences in the different consumer touchpoints, such as websites and outbound communications, enabled by personalization tools with the use of consumer data. The goal is to be relevant for the consumer to build loyalty and drive conversion.


**Who you are:**
* Curious and analytical with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make informed decisions in a fast-paced environment.
* 3+ years of experience in product management, IT consulting or management consulting.
* Extensive knowledge and understanding of consumer data, identity management and personalization concepts, including technology trends and consumer expectation trends
* Broad skillset within stakeholder management, technology, consumer data, and user experience design.
* Bachelor's degree in information technology, business & economics, computer science, or similar field is a plus.
* Exposure to agile methodologies and product management tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence).
* Demonstrated ability to take ownership, lead initiatives, and deliver results.


**Where you’ll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Benefits include:**
* Flexible working hours/hybrid work environment.
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services.
* Family-and-friends discounts and benefits such as parental leave top-up.
* Insurance policy plan.
* Learning opportunities and flexible career path.


**Find out more on:**
 Electrolux Group: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux

title: FinCrime Prevention Director
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 









 We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Director of Financial Crime Operations to lead and enhance our financial crime prevention efforts across the EEA and UK regions. This critical role will oversee all aspects of FinCrime Operations, including Transaction Surveillance, KYC/KYB, and Fraud Prevention. The ideal candidate will be a strategic leader with a proven track record of managing managers, driving transformation projects, and navigating the complexities of financial crime in a fast-paced fintech environment. A strong background in payments, particularly instant payments, and experience managing risks associated with high-risk merchants and clients is highly desirable.
 








**Responsibilities:
 

  




**Strategic Leadership:** 
* Develop and implement a comprehensive financial crime strategy aligned with the company's growth objectives and regulatory requirements across the EEA and UK
* Provide strategic direction and oversight for Transaction Surveillance, KYC/KYB, and Fraud Prevention teams
* Stay abreast of evolving financial crime trends, regulations, and technologies, and proactively adapt strategies accordingly



  




**Operational Excellence:** 
* Lead and manage a team of FinCrime Operations managers, fostering a culture of high performance, collaboration, and continuous improvement
* Ensure the effective and efficient execution of financial crime prevention processes and controls
* Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify areas for improvement and optimize operational efficiency



  




**Risk Management:** 
* Oversee the management of financial crime risks associated with high-risk merchants and clients
* Ensure compliance with AML/CFT regulations and industry best practices across all operational areas
* Develop and maintain robust risk assessment frameworks and methodologies



  




**Transformation and Innovation:** 
* Drive transformation projects to enhance financial crime prevention capabilities, with a strong focus on leveraging AI and automation
* Evaluate and implement new technologies and solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness
* Lead the development and implementation of advanced transaction monitoring and fraud detection systems



  




**Stakeholder Management:** 
* Build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders, including compliance, legal, product, and technology teams
* Represent the company in interactions with regulatory authorities and external partners
* Work closely with the product team to influence product development to create more robust fraud and AML controls



  




**Qualifications:** 
* Extensive experience in financial crime prevention, with a focus on Transaction Surveillance, KYC/KYB, and Fraud Prevention
* Proven experience in managing managers and leading large, complex teams
* Understanding of AML/CFT regulations and industry best practices in the EEA and UK
* Experience managing risks associated with high-risk merchants and clients
* Demonstrated ability to drive transformation projects and implement innovative solutions, particularly those leveraging AI
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Fluency in English
* Experience working in a fintech or other fast paced environment
* Experience with rule based and machine learning transaction monitoring systems



  




**Preferred Qualifications:** 
* Strong background in payments, with a preference for experience in instant payments
* Experience with AI-driven financial crime prevention solutions
* Experience working in a high-growth fintech environment
* Experience working with international regulators



  




**What's in it for you?** 
* **Shape Your Role and Make an Impact** 
 : A role where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously take on exciting new challenges
* **Fantastic Benefits** 
 :
* **25/30 days of holiday** 
 for a healthy work-life balance
* **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
* **Parental leave top-up** 
 , supporting you during family milestones
* **Daily breakfast** 
 and other on-site perks to make your day that much easier
* Plus many more benefits designed to support your well-being!






  




  



 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and k
 

 indly submit your CV in English.**

title: SAP Master Data Solution Architect
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **4+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
 



 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
 



**Rollbeskrivning:** 




 The Solution Architect (SA) for Master Data has responsibility for ensuring the timely and fit for purpose design of all elements of the assigned technology capability. He or She is responsible for the solution design and architecture within their technical area and support the functional requirements across business process areas
 



  





 \* Lead the design and architecture of SAP solutions, ensuring alignment with business goals and best practices within the area of Master Data
 



 \* Provide strategic guidance and expertise in SAP, including system configuration, integration and optimization
 



 \*Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyse business requirements, translating them into effective SAP solutions
 



 \*Oversee the development of detailed solution architectures and ensure the successful deployment of SAP products and guide towards adherence to standard to avoid customizations
 



 \*Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, project managers, SI-partners and business representatives to deliver E2E SAP solutions
 



 \*Stay current with industry trends, SAP updates and emerging technologies within his or hers area
 



 \* Possess a clear understanding of the interdependencies the assigned process area(s) and other process areas
 



 \* Ensure a healthy and stable application portfolio with prioritizing and following up on problem tickets
 



  





 Experience level
 



 High level of experience from several similar assignments/projects. Can work independently and to some extent lead a small group and develop within the area.
 



  





**Additional experience description** 




 \* Minimum 4 years of experience working as a SAP Solution Architect or similar role/experience with Master Data being the primary field/expertise
 



 \* Proven experience working with relevant modules/areas wrt S/4 Master Data, MDG and CAR (DDF/MDTM)
 



 \* In-depth knowledge of SAP architecture for relevant modules, capabilities and best practices wrt Master Data
 



 \*Strong understanding of business processes and the ability to align SAP solutions with organizational goals
 



 \*SAP certification in relevant modules or S/4 Hana is highly desirable
 



 Experience with SAP cloud solutions is a plus
 



 \*Experience with tools such as JIRA and Focused Build is a plus
 



 \*Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
 



 \*Comfortable and capable in facilitating workshops and driving decisions
 



 Education:
 



 \*Higher degree within Engineering, IT or similar field
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
 



 Arbetsplats och kultur
 



 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
 



 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Commercial Manager - Soundly
description:
**Join Epidemic Sound and Soundly - a global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking. Epidemic Sound is an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Soundly is a world-leading sound effects platform trusted by some of the biggest names in the industry, including Netflix, Warner Bros, Audible, Ubisoft, SVT, and BBC. It combines a premium, in-house sound effects library with powerful search tools and seamless integration into creative workflows, making it the go-to choice for sound design in film, TV, games, and more. Curious to learn more - find us on www.getsoundly.com.**
 We are now looking for a high performing and business minded
 **Commercial Manager** 
 to join the Soundly Sales team, working closely with the Enterprise Sales team at the Epidemic Sound HQ in Stockholm. The role will initially be reporting to the Head of Enterprise Sales Nordics with close collaboration with the Soundly team, you will however work globally across all our teams based in NY, LA, London, Berlin and Seoul.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 As a Commercial Manager for Soundly, you will play a critical role in building the enterprise sales capabilities of Soundly and establishing a close collaboration with the Epidemic Enterprise sales team. Your responsibility will be to define go to market strategies, secure growth and ensure the success of Soundly by setting the foundation for and expanding the business in the B2B segment, as well as identifying cross-selling opportunities and securing collaboration between Soundly and Epidemic Sound.
   

  

 We are looking for a candidate with experience in complex sales, as well as experience in working with post production houses and large media companies, having an entrepreneurial mindset and can-do attitude. You will be expected to lead internal strategic initiatives to develop and grow the Soundly and Epidemic Sound collaboration, while ensuring set targets are met and exceeded.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Build the foundation to take Soundly to market under the Epidemic Sound umbrella.
* Carry out market-, competitor- customer- and risk analyses.
* Define go-to-market strategies and develop value proposition, pitch and needed marketing collateral.
* Identify new clients, conduct contract negotiations, obtain orders and establish new accounts/relationships for Soundly.
* Own the full customer sales cycle, both inbound and outbound sales, from first lead to customer success.
* Work closely with the Epidemic Sound sales team to identify cross selling opportunities, initiatives and larger deals.
* Share the knowledge on Soundly at Epidemic Sound by providing training, joining Enterprise customer meetings and sharing knowledge.
* Work closely with other departments at both Soundly and Epidemic Sound to achieve company goals such as maximising customer satisfaction, customer knowledge, and product development, ensuring a strong product-market fit.
* Set foundation for how Epidemic Sound Enterprise offering and Soundly offering co-exist including pricing strategies, value proposition and pitch.
* Contribute to company OKRs to ensure initiatives, processes, and programs are achieved.
* Stay up to date with trends and best practices within the field.
* Meet and exceed an elevated yearly sales target.


**Requirements:**
 You’re a tech savvy, strategic team player passionate about sales and tech. You understand the importance of and take pride in new business acquisitions and business growth. You take initiative, have a high level of business acumen, thrive from working in a high pace enterprise environment, and enjoy nothing more than building new relationships with prospective customers. You have experience from either the editing, post-production or sound design industry and LOVE sound.
   

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**
* 6+ years prior sales experience at a senior level selling complex enterprise solutions with a strong track-record of exceeding sales targets.
* Fluency in English, both verbal and written.
* Comfortable developing strong relationships and working closely with middle management and C-level executives from both a relationship building and a sales/business development perspective.
* A passion for technology, combined with an understanding of the workflows and needs of video editors and sound designers in large media companies.
* A self-starter who takes initiative to get things done.
* Passionate about helping prospective customers scale up their business through Music, Media and SaaS solutions.
* Familiarity with Salesforce CRM and other typical systems such as Ironclad, Jira, Netsuite etc.
* An active interest in music, sound and/or media is a big plus.
* Adaptive and not afraid of change within a rapidly growing company.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Senior Business Development Manager, DSO
job_function: Business Development, General Business, and Management
company_industry: Services for Renewable Energy and Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution
description:
Do you want to be part of facilitating the green transition? Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your actions drive meaningful change? Do you enjoy solving hard problems together with ambitious people? If this sounds like you, this could be a perfect match.
 



  





**Join us to facilitate the green transition** 




 Electrification and the transition to fossil-free energy create fantastic opportunities for us as individuals, as a company, and for society at large. However, it also creates challenges, especially for our energy system. Ingrid Capacity is a new kind of energy company on a mission to shape the future of energy. We challenge conventional energy models with intelligent energy services for grid operators and users. By uniquely combining software, hardware, and commercial innovation, we tackle one of the biggest bottlenecks to the energy transition: electricity grid constraints. This enables us to accelerate electrification and contribute to a more resilient, competitive, and sustainable energy system. Our impact is here and now. Since our founding in 2022, we have built a leading electricity trading and optimization platform, commissioned and now operate over 200 MWh of large-scale energy storage facilities, and have an additional 340 MWh under construction across Europe. Today, Ingrid Capacity is in a rapid growth phase.
 



  





**About the role** 




 Are you a strategic dealmaker with a passion for innovation? Do you have the drive and network to break new grounds in the energy sector? We are looking for a Senior Business Development Manager - New Business to lead the development of new revenue streams. This role presents a unique opportunity to establish and develop a new business sector, where your expertise in structuring agreements and securing high-value deals will be instrumental to success.
 



  





 As a Senior Business Development Manager, you will be at the forefront of developing and negotiating agreements with utilities and Distribution System Operators (DSOs), creating innovative solutions that do not yet exist in the market. You will work cross-functionally with internal teams and external stakeholders to structure, negotiate, and execute agreements that generate revenue from energy storage solutions.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Lead and drive the structuring, negotiation, and execution of off-taker agreements with utilities and Distribution System Operators (DSOs).
* Design and implement a strategic commercial plan to drive business growth and achieve revenue objectives.
* Manage the end-to-end new business process, from lead identification to deal closure, leveraging a value-driven business strategy.
* Identify and develop new business opportunities, fostering strategic relationships with key stakeholders to accelerate growth and market expansion.
* Understanding of revenue cap regulations to enable the structure of complex agreements that align with regulatory frameworks and organizational growth objectives.
* Collaborate cross-functionally and work closely with internal teams (technical, product, and finance) to create commercially viable and strategically sound agreements.
* Proactively adapt to evolving market regulations and technical requirements, leveraging innovation to enhance business innovation and operational efficiency.



  





**Key qualifications** 



* University degree in engineering, finance, business, management or a related field.
* Senior-level experience and strong network in the energy sector, preferably working with or within utilities, DSOs, or energy companies.
* Proven track record in business development, or strategic partnerships within the energy sector.
* Deep knowledge and understanding of energy markets, grid infrastructure, and regulatory framew
 *o* 
 rks.
* Fluency in English and Swedish is required.



  





**Personal Skills:** 




 In addition to relevant work experience, we’re looking for someone with the right personal skills and motivation, and a genuine passion for renewable energy.
 


* Project management skills – Able to lead complex initiatives from concept to execution with precision.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with a proactive approach – Continuously seeking innovative solutions and identifying and executing on new business opportunities.
* Analytical and problem-solving skills – Comfortable navigating regulatory frameworks and structuring complex deals.
* Stakeholder management and relationship-building skills – Adept at engaging executive-level stakeholders as well as working cross-functionally internally.
* Resilient and adaptable – Thrives in a fast-paced, evolving market, adjusting strategies to align with new industry trends.
* Driven self-starter – Takes ownership of your work, independently driving initiatives forward.



  





**What we offer** 




 At Ingrid Capacity, we are not just employees; we are pioneers, visionaries, and catalysts for change. We are at the forefront of the global energy transition, dedicated to shaping the future of power generation. Our company is more than a workplace; it is a platform for innovation, where we dare to push boundaries and turn bold ideas into reality.
 



 We firmly believe that the foundation of any successful company lies in its culture. At Ingrid Capacity, we understand that building a thriving organization demands more than just technology and innovation; it requires a company culture firmly rooted in trust, growth, and the ability to learn from mistakes. We believe that skills can be nurtured in a variety of contexts, starting from within oneself and growing together with people we trust. We are also serious about the wellbeing of our colleagues and having fun together, and with regularly hosted social activities and group training classes, we create a workplace where we can truly thrive.
 



  





**Applications** 




 Sounds like a match? Don’t be a stranger and welcome to apply! We’ll make selections on an ongoing basis and finalize the recruitment as soon as we’ve found the perfect
 



 match.We look forward to hearing from you!
 



 /Team Ingrid Capacity

title: Head of SEO
company_industry: Advertising Services, Marketing Services, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
*Do you thrive on leading SEO strategies that drive real business impact? Are you ready to take ownership of a growing team and help some of the biggest brands in the Nordics excel in organic search?*
 Then you might be our new Head of SEO!
   

  

**Build and grow our SEO team while driving client success**
 As Head of SEO at s360/Docklin - part of s360, you will take on a pivotal role in our highly specialized SEO team. You will be responsible for setting the strategic direction for SEO, managing key client relationships, and building a team in Stockholm. You will also work closely with other disciplines within digital marketing, such as paid media and data analytics, to create holistic growth strategies.
   

  

**Moreover, You Can Look Forward To**
* Shaping SEO strategy and execution: Define and drive SEO strategies for some of the biggest e-commerce and enterprise brands in the Nordics, ensuring measurable organic success.
* Managing high-impact clients: Oversee a portfolio of clients and act as a trusted advisor to CMOs, Heads of Digital, and other stakeholders.
* Leading and mentoring: Grow and build our team of SEO specialists, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.
* Driving innovation: Leverage s360 cutting-edge python-led and standalone SEO tools to keep clients ahead of competitors.
* Collaboration across teams: Work alongside other digital marketing specialists, analysts, and developers to ensure a seamless, data-driven approach to growth.


**Join our ambitious journey!**
 You will be joining one of Scandinavia’s largest SEO teams consisting of 50+ experts who collaborate daily to drive growth for our clients. You’ll, however, be the first SEO person in our Stockholm office. s360 acquired Docklin in early 2025 and you’ll join the team with the responsibility of building and growing the SEO offering, both in terms of revenue and team size. We have big ambitions.
   

  

 We are proud of our award-winning SEO cases, which have received major industry recognition for excellence in search and content strategy.
   

  

**SEO leader with a proactive and innovative mindset**
 We seek a strategic, experienced SEO leader who can drive results while fostering a high-performance team environment.
   

  

**To The Role You Will Bring**
* 6+ years of experience in SEO with a proven track record of driving results for enterprise-level clients.
* Strong leadership skills, with experience managing and mentoring SEO teams.
* Expertise in Strategic & Technical SEO, including site architecture, crawling, indexing, and content strategies.
* A consultative approach with the ability to engage and influence senior stakeholders.
* Proficiency in English and Swedish, both written and spoken.
* Experience with leading SEO tools such as Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, Google Search Console, and Analytics.
* A data-driven mindset, using insights to make strategic decisions and optimize performance.
* A strong understanding of cross-channel digital marketing, including paid search, social, and analytics.


**What It Is Like Working At S360**
 You will help shape the development of one of the Nordic’s leading and fastest-growing consulting firms within digital marketing, tech and data. You will be part of a strong team with some of the country's best specialists, all striving to make each delivery better than the last.
   

  

 What sets us apart is our vibrant team culture. Throughout the year, we host social events such as Friday bars, sports tournaments and more. We organize meetups with all our offices from around the world and have special interest communities ranging from Counter-Strike and running clubs to kitesurfing and knitting.
   

  

**Join Us And Experience**
* Adown-to-earth culture where constructive feedback and collaboration drive success.
* Freedom with responsibility, including flexible working hours.
* Exciting, high-impact projects, working with some of the biggest brands in the Nordics.
* A high-expertise environment where you can develop alongside top professionals in digital marketing.


**We’d love to hear from you**
 Is this the right fit for you? Do you have any questions? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Erik Östberg at [email protected].
   

  

 We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.
   

  

**About S360**
 s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +330 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

title: Audit Manager, Audit LC&I
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
