* Trade settlement and cash management experience is preferential.
* Experience with Bloomberg, front-office systems and/or corporate banking portals is considered a plus.
* Previous experience from working in a Back- or Middle-Office role is also considered a plus.
* Hands on experience with MS Office, and specifically good knowledge of MS Excel is required. Fluent in English and Swedish
* Attention to detail
* Analytical mindset
* Good organizational and time-management skills
* Proactive self-starter with desire to learn, grow, and be challenged
* Demonstrated ability to work within an evolving and dynamic environment


**We offer**
 At East Capital Group we strongly believe in inclusion, fairness, and diversity. You will work in a true international environment, where you will have colleagues representing 20 different nationalities. We offer a very a dynamic work environment with engaged and skilled colleagues. You will be sitting in modern offices, located in the city- and business centre of Stockholm.
   

  

 We want to make sure that all entry level and less experienced colleagues joining us are provided hands on coaching and career development within the East Capital Group, where your personal aspirations and goals coincide with the further development of your team, your department, and the East Capital Group in general, as far as possible. With the right mindset and focus on your end, you will early on be given broad and exciting responsibilities and projects, where you can count on coaching and mentorship inside and outside your immediate team.
   

  

 This is a temporary that is paid on hourly basis. Although this is a summer internship, an earlier start date i.e April/May would be a plus.
   

  

 Interviews will be held ongoing, and we may fill the position earlier than application deadline. Therefore, please submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than
 **April 18, 2025.**
 Anställningsform: särskild visstidsanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 40tim/vecka | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/3 | Publicerat: 2025-03-25 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-18

title: Product Expert - Digital Workplace (P&M)
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma Länsförsäkringars digitala framtid? Drivs du av utmaningar och förändring? Är du dessutom en god kommunikatör som enkelt förklarar teknik och komplexa samband? Då kan detta vara rätt roll för dig*
**Om jobbet**
 Vi söker en Produktexpert inom Digital Workplace för att driva utvecklingen av våra tjänster med fokus på mobilitet, produktivitet och flexibilitet (Productivity & Mobility). Du ansvarar för den virtuella och mobila arbetsplatsen samt kringliggande tjänster för våra 12 000 medarbetare.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära Product Owner med teknisk planering och roadmap, samt säkerställer att tjänsterna används optimalt i samarbete med Product Area Architect och IT-partners – där du har en central kravställande roll. Tillsammans med IT-säkerhet och andra intressenter ser du till att produkterna följer säkerhetsstrategier och riktlinjer.
   

  

 För att driva innovation och skapa värde för verksamheten håller du dig uppdaterad om nya teknologier och trender inom området.
   

  

 I rollen ingår:
   

  

* Operativ ledning och utveckling av den virtuella och mobila arbetsplatsen
* Optimering, automation och livscykelhantering av tjänster inom området
* Säkerställande av hög kvalitet, tillgänglighet och digital medarbetarupplevelse (DEX)


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig med IT-examen eller motsvarande erfarenhet. Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med IT-förvaltning/utveckling inom Digital Workplace i större organisationer.
   

  

 Vi ser också att du har:
   

  

* Mycket goda kunskaper om teknologier och tjänster kring området End User Computing (primärt fokus på Virtual Desktop Infrastructure och Enterprise Mobility Management)
* Mycket goda kunskaper om teknologier och tjänster som berör Productivity & Mobility inom M365 och Citrix samt hur dessa hanteras i Evergreen processen.
* Goda kunskaper kring IT-infrastruktur och IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av operativa processer och att designa och driva en produkt/tjänst under hela dess livscykel
* Erfarenhet av operativ styrning och automation exempelvis genom skript
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt agila metoder


 Meriterande är erfarenhet av Digital Experience Management samt verktyg för analys, automation och proaktiv/prediktiv IT-leverans.
   

  

 Som person är du självständig, initiativrik och helhetsfokuserad. Du har god samarbetsförmåga och behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift. Detta då du kommer att ha dialog med många parter, både internt och externt.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Hos oss på Länsförsäkringar och inom enheten Digital & IT finner du en plats för mod och möjligheter och får representera ett av Sveriges starkaste varumärken med stort samhällsengagemang som skapar trygghet och möjligheter för våra närmare 4 000 000 kunder. Hos oss kan du fortsätta utvecklas och jobba långsiktigt med att göra skillnad för alla våra medarbetare i en stor och stabil organisation inom bank & försäkring. Du kommer ha en viktig roll i en viktig och spännande resa i att öka digital stabilitet och upplevelse med kunden i fokus.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-09**

title: Solution Engineer – Core Application & Platform Operations
description:
Do you want to take on a role ensuring the availability, performance and stability of enterprise applications hosted on Microsoft technologies? Then we have the role for you!
   

  

 At Sandvik Group IT we’re currently looking for a Solution Engineer to our Core Application and Platform Operations. Welcome to a dynamic and developing environment where collaboration is the key!
   

  

**About Your Job**
 As our Solution Engineer, you play a key role in transforming business requirements into IT solutions – offering technical guidance to the product team to ensure alignment with goals and strategies. You focus on maintaining IT service continuity by managing incidents, changes and problem resolution using the ITIL framework. You also ensure the creation and maintenance of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for troubleshooting and system maintenance. To protect infrastructure and applications, you implement security best practices, ensuring compliance with industry standards and applying system hardening techniques.
   

  

 You excel in collaborative work environments, fostering strong relationships with diverse stakeholders and leading complex technical implementation within your area of expertise. Your team acts as a bridge between infrastructure and applications, providing expert services and innovative solutions to ensure seamless integration, innovation and operational excellence.
   

  

 The location for this position is Sandviken or Stockholm, and we offer you a hybrid work solution. As your team and stakeholders are located on both sites, some travel between them might be required.
   

  

**About You**
 We’re looking for someone with a strong knowledge of Windows Server for system management, troubleshooting and maintenance. You have hands-on experience with IIS for hosting and configuring web applications, as well as of middleware technologies for managing Java-based applications. Proficiency in MS SQL for database management, queries, backup and performance tuning is a must. To be successful in this role, you need knowledge in CI/CD pipelines, version control and deployment automation and the ability to automate tasks, perform bulk configurations and troubleshoot using scripts in PowerShell Scripting. Experience with cloud platforms and an SSL certificate is a plus. Being part of a truly global environment, we look for proficiency in English, verbally and in writing. Knowledge of Swedish is a plus.
   

  

 You’re an excellent communicator and collaborator who easily build strong relationships with the people you encounter. Having attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset, you ensure accuracy in configurations, updates and documentation. You’re curious and flexible, with an understanding of customer needs - enabling you to apply expertise to create meaningful outcomes.
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact
   

  

* Sofia Shanmugavel R0075603, recruiting manager +46 (0)76-535 65 03
* Pasi Yrjänheikki, Competence Manager +46 (0)70-224 60 54


 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

* Malena Rackner, Unionen, +46 (0)70 242 33 90
* Göran Norell, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70 616 43 78
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Hanna Thomas
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than April 8th, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0077014.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

title: Google Ads Specialist
description:
Vision Healthcare (VHC) is a fast-growing, pan-European, digital-first omni-channel group driven by an innovative buy-and-build strategy. Our network includes leading brands and direct-to-consumer channels such as branded e-shops, marketplaces, and e-pharma platforms. We specialize in offering high-quality vitamins, minerals, supplements, nutraceuticals, beauty nutriments, and over-the-counter (OTC) medicines.
 



  





 Our online-first D2C strategy helps us foster strong, lasting relationships with consumers, empowering them to take charge of their health and wellness. At VHC, we encourage entrepreneurial thinking and lean but effective processes that allow our team to make a real impact. We focus on solutions that are both creative and pragmatic, aiming for simplicity and efficiency. VHC develops and markets some of the leading supplements in the Nordic, including brands like Collaxan, Lectinect Mage, VigroVital and ProstaQR.
 



  





 We expect our people to think outside the box and go the extra mile in order to find innovative solutions for our consumers’ needs. VHC stimulates its employees to learn from each other and to make an impact. Only then will we keep improving and delivering better results.
 



  





**What will you do?** 



* Manage and optimize Google Ads accounts for various markets.
* Ensure profitability within agreed parameters and business goals.
* Analyze data, prepare reports, and propose improvements.
* Monitor trends and innovations in Google Ads advertising and implement proven solutions.
* Collaborate with other departments (e.g., marketing, sales, IT) to achieve common business goals.
* Proactively implement growth-hacking strategies.



  





  





**What do we expect?** 



* At least 3 years of experience managing Google Ads campaigns, with a focus on e-commerce.
* Understanding of ROI/CPA and other key metrics.
* In-depth knowledge of all types of Google Ads campaigns, including strategies for PMax, Shopping, Search, Display, and Video advertising.
* Experience managing high budgets is a plus.
* Excellent analytical thinking and the ability to interpret complex data.
* Proactivity, initiative, and the ability to work independently.
* Experience with Google Ads advertising in the Nordics market is required.
* Proficiency in English and Swedish



  





**What We Offer?** 



* A dynamic, fast-paced international work environment with a collaborative and entrepreneurial culture.
* Opportunities to shape the future of digital healthcare and drive meaningful impact.
* Participation in our VHC Academy providing unique insight into best digital marketing practices
* 25 days of vacation
* Full-time permanent employment contract
* Employer-financed pension plan, employee discounts, and access to corporate benefits.
* International travel when needed

title: Front Office Associate - Nights to Sheraton Stockholm Hotel
description:
Step into a role that redefines excellence at the Sheraton Stockholm Hotel, a hallmark of hospitality since 1971 in the heart of Sweden's bustling capital. Aligned with our innovative owners Archer Hotel Management and Marriott International, we merge rich cultural history with modern luxury and a deep dedication to sustainability.
   

  

 We are now looking for a motivated and compassionate Front Office Associate to join our front desk team during the night to ensure exceptional customer service as we align the hotel as one of the top luxury hotels in Stockholm post-renovation.
   

  

 If you have a passion for hospitality and a focus on delivering outstanding guest experiences, we want to hear from you! We believe in nurturing talent and providing opportunities for professional development. Whether you are starting your journey in hospitality or looking to take the next step in your career, we offer a workplace where you can learn, grow, and thrive.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Exceed guest expectations in a dynamic environment
* Ensure efficient and welcoming service for all guests
* Handle check-ins and check-outs
* Maintain full awareness of the hotel's occupancy status and room availability
* Maintain high levels of customer satisfaction assuring personalized service and addressing guest concerns/needs promptly
* Communicate and record all feedback and complaints according to established procedures
* Ensure effective communication and collaboration with other teams and departments
* Foster good relationships with all internal and external customers


 Qualifications:
   

  

* Has experience working at a hotel front desk
* Has good knowledge and experience working with Opera
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English, spoken and written; additional languages are a plus
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Possess strong computer skills
* Proactive and independent work approach
* Good problem-solving skills with a focus on guest needs and expectation
* Ability to handle high-pressure situations with professionalism


 What We Offer:
   

  

* A night shift position
* A permanent full-time position following the 6-month probation period and we adhere to collective bargaining agreements
* Chance of being part of one of the biggest renovation and re-positioning projects in Stockholm's hotel scene
* Employment in a company with great opportunities for growth, where our core value is "Putting People First"
* A dynamic and inclusive work environment
* Employee discounted rates at over 8500+ hotels worldwide


 Join our team and play a key role in creating memorable experiences for our guests! The Sheraton brand, established in 1937, has been synonymous with excellence in hospitality. The Sheraton Stockholm Hotel, opened in 1971 as the first international 5 star hotel in Stockholm, and it’s an icon in Sweden’s capital city. As part of Marriott International, Sheraton Stockholm Hotel is providing guests with thoughtful amenities, contemporary accommodation, and the best city center location. Our commitment to sustainability aligns with our owner Archer Hotel Managements ethos, making us a unique choice for conscientious travelers. Redefining the Essence of Hospitality
   

  

 We have recently started our much-anticipated renovation journey at Sheraton Stockholm.
   

  

 This marks the beginning of our mission to redefine the essence of hospitality. We will transform all our spaces, hotel rooms, implement new food and beverage concepts and expand our gym and wellness. As we embark on this transformation, we are seeking the best industry people to join our team.
   

  

 About Archer Hotel Management Archer Hotel Management (AHM) is the operational arm of Archer Hotel Capital (AHC), committed to pioneering sustainable management of upscale and luxury hotels in Europe. AHM is dedicated to making a 'world of difference,' empowering teams to foster entrepreneurial cultures and deliver operational excellence. Our commitment includes achieving net zero carbon emissions by 2030 and gaining third-party certification for sustainable practices.

title: Konstruktör säkerhetsteknik
description:
Nu söker vi en konstruktör som vill vara med och bidra till att säkerställa att vårt flygplatsskydd är i toppklass. Du blir en del av ett team på 25 kollegor vars uppdrag är att äga, underhålla och utveckla dom teletekniska säkerhetsanläggningarna på våra 10 flygplatser och därigenom säkerställa funktion, kapacitet och tillgänglighet till våra verksamheter.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
* Projektering och konstruktion för dom teletekniska säkerhet systemen som finns på våra 10 flygplatser.
* Upprätta tekniska handlingar och ritningar.
* Säkerställa att projekten uppfyller gällande standarder och föreskrifter.
* Samarbeta med andra discipliner inom företaget för att skapa önskad funktion.
* Uppdatera och underhålla den teletekniska dokumentationen.
* Konsultativt stöd internt.


 Tjänsteresor kan förekomma.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du gillar komplexa problem och utmaningar samt har en naturlig förmåga att hitta lösningar. Du är en skicklig kommunikatör och förstår vikten av strukturerade tidsplaner för att leverera i tid. Du driver ditt arbete framåt, är anpassningsbar och gillar att samarbeta med kollegor och andra aktörer.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Utbildning på gymnasienivå eller yrkeshögskola, exempelvis inom IT, teknik eller el.
* Kunskap för IT- och nätverkslösningar.
* Kunskap inom IT-infrastruktur och nätverkskommunikation.
* Minst fem års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet inom området, gärna inom säkerhetsbranschen.
* Erfarenhet av att efterleva regelverk och interna riktlinjer.
* Goda kunskaper av projektering i MagiCAD el och AutoCAD.
* Goda kunskaper i Office 365.
* God kommunikativ förmåga på både svenska och engelska.


 Det är meriterande om du har gått:
   

  

* Grundkurs eller likvärdig utbildning för Pacom Unison med Sentrion eller dess ersättnings hårdvara med fokus på systemets komponenter och på installation av dessa.
* Grundkurs + likvärdig utbildning gällande Bosch IP-kameror (Camera fundamentals och Project fundamentals eller likvärdiga) med fokus på IP-kameror och transmissionsutrustning och på installation av dessa.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Vi erbjuder dig en omväxlande och glad arbetsplats där ingen dag är den andra lik. Visste du att på Swedavia får du bidrag till din arbetsresa om du åker kollektivt, elbil, cykel eller tillsammans med en kollega? Du har också möjlighet att semesterväxla och byta bort din semesterersättning mot lediga dagar. Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner på Förmåner | Om Swedavia .
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta dan.fornes@swedavia.se
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag är den 8/4, urval sker löpande så tveka inte att söka redan idag!**
**Hur är det att arbeta på Swedavia?**
 Vårt fokus är att möjliggöra hållbart resande och uppmuntra nytänkande för att skapa en välkomnande, trygg och inkluderande arbetsgemenskap där du kan växa och göra verklig skillnad – läs mer här! Jobba hos oss | Om Swedavia
   

  

 Då flygplatser är en säkerhetsklassad verksamhet genomgår samtliga kandidater som går vidare i rekryteringsprocessen en bakgrundskontroll. För vissa tjänster även en säkerhetsprövning. Swedavia är även en drogfri arbetsplats med nolltolerans mot droger. Drogtester genomförs före anställning och sker slumpmässigt under anställningen.

title: Open application for Senior Game Programmers
description:
*We invite talented individuals to submit spontaneous applications for the position of Senior Game Programmer as we always try to stay in touch with talented people within our industry.*
**Your mission**
 As a Senior Game Programmer you will be working in a small team solving challenging tasks using C++. You will be developing features and systems in close communication with designers and artists which will fundamentally shape the experiences we create. Our developers have a high level of ownership over their work and it’s important that you are able to plan and manage your work efficiently.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build and maintain well-engineered C++ code with high levels of stability and performance.
* Design and implement features in different focus areas such as gameplay systems, AI, networking, graphics, user interface, our scripting language, and optimization.
* As a Senior Developer we expect you to solve problems and provide guidance using your expert-level knowledge and help raise the level of other team members you work with.


 If you are passionate about game development and have a proven track record of creating exceptional gaming experiences, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**Work culture**
 We are dedicated to crafting thought-provoking games that our players adore and are eager to enjoy endlessly. Every member of the Paradox team is committed to contributing their best and sharing the drive to achieve our goals, reaching new pinnacles as a united force. Creativity, autonomy, and self-initiation are the building blocks of our game development process, all made feasible by a substantial foundation of trust. We are establishing this trust-based environment by having faith in our colleagues to act with the best of intentions.
   

  

 Our culture evolves through our engagements with our players and our deep understanding of their desires and expectations. We're dedicated to comprehending our players and what they truly cherish in our games, as well as their mindset while enjoying them.
   

  

**Practical information**
 Scope: Full-time and permanent
   

  

 Reports to: Program Manager
   

  

 Location: This position is based in Sweden, Stockholm
   

  

 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Modality Sales Specialist AM&D International Markets
description:
**Job Title**
 Modality Sales Specialist AM&D International Markets
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Modality Sales Specialist has the opportunity to drive new business opportunities for Ambulatory Monitoring & Diagnostics (AM&D) International Markets (part of the Monitoring Cluster). In this role, you predominantly focus on the growth of the Diagnostic Cardiology Solutions (DCS) business in UK&I, Nordics and Benelux. You create and implement this growth strategy, for which you work closely together with customers, our indirect channel partners and local market organizations. In this role, you also contribute to the go-to-market strategy for ePatch and Cardiologs. This means that you conduct analyses of health systems, market sizes, reimbursement landscapes, and competition.
   

  

 As such, you drive multiple new business initiatives, gather marketing intelligence, drive projects, compose value propositions and create business models to assess the feasibility of these new opportunities. You feel challenged in a landscape of activities that range from conceptual thinking and financial analyses to hands-on deal-making with strategic business partners and customers. You act as an entrepreneur within a professional, innovative and well-reputed healthcare organization with virtually unlimited possibilities.
   

  

**In the scope of Diagnostic Cardiology Solutions, you are responsible for**
* Maximizing Order Intake, Margin, Market Share and Customer Satisfaction for the AM&D modalities and related business solutions
* Funnel visibility and quality for UKI, Nordics and Benelux including forecast accuracy, installed-base protection and win/loss analyses
* Formulate AM&D sales strategy for UKI, Nordics and Benelux
* Formulate and drive local product marketing plan with alignment to International AM&D activities
* Develop and manage Key Opinion Leaders with support of Local Business Team
* Provide Sales support for potential opportunities including providing product and clinical presentations
* Provide support to Account Managers and Channel Partners on Product Configurations, NPIs and Competitive Intelligence
* Perform Win-loss Analysis and to collect/update market intelligence
* Coordinate technical, business and clinical application team support with the local business team to ensure sustainable good customer experience
* Developing and executing the go-to-market plan for AM&D.
* Working with the Business to ensure perfect New Product Introductions and Launches.
* Engaging with Global/Market Team to develop the most enterprise-wide solutions.
* Driving the development of workflow consultancy skills of relevant stakeholders of AM&D, to strengthen Philips’ ability to support customers in improving their operational and clinical outcomes.
* Understanding the diagnostic ECG landscape, through the analysis of competition, customer needs, trends, technological innovation and reimbursement.
* Supporting the Business by providing inputs (incl. market insights and trends, business model options, etc.) and reviewing the value proposition and global plans/roadmaps in the product development phase.


**You're the right fit if:**
* Bachelor's Degree in any relevant
* At least 3 - 5 years of experience in sales, product management, marketing, and customer success management. Medical industry preferred
* 1+ years of experience in working with channel partners on sales growth, preferably in the healthcare space
* Business proficient in English. Excellent oral and written communication skills including making impactful presentations
* A structured, conceptual thinker, with an entrepreneurial mindset
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Experience with working in a cross-functional team and a strong team player with excellent stakeholder management skills
* Excellent analytical and communication skills


**Why should you join Philips?**
 Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.
   

  

 To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

title: Breakfast & Lunch Waiter - Extra
description:
*Do you have an eye for details and like to give excellent service during the most important part of the day? Then this is the role for you!*
**The Magic Starts At Six**
 At Six is a contemporary art and design hotel with 343 rooms and suites, including our Masterpiece Suite and 32 longstay apartments adjacent to the hotel. In the house you will also find - a gym, our wine bar Blanche & Hierta, At Six Cocktail Bar, and our Dining Room, along with our rooftop bar Stockholm Under Stjärnorna. A big part of the hotel is Social At Six, our 3000m2 flexible event and meeting space where the only limits are the ones of your imagination.
   

  

 At Six is a part of Petter Stordalen's hotel group Nordic Hotels & Resorts which also includes the neighboring hotel Hobo, Sommerro, Villa Copenhagen, The Thief, Copperhill, and Yasuragi among others.
   

  

 At Six is striving to elevate the meaning of hospitality while perfecting the art of details. Today, we’re one of the leading choices for high-end travelers in Scandinavia. Our employees pride themselves in creating the best possible experience for our guests, in a warm and friendly work environment. It’s a simple equation; happy employees = happy and satisfied guests.
   

  

**Passionate About Service**
 In the heart of the hotel we have our restaurant Dining Room serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. Our aim is to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere with a focus on good food and excellent service. We focus on delivering a unique experience for our guests with high attention to detail and where we continue to challenge ourselves to grow, learn and develop both as individuals but also as a team. With a can-do attitude we always make sure to deliver as a team and make sure to have fun while working. It’s a prestige-less department where we all help each other out to reach our goals.
   

  

**The Role and Our Philosophy**
 The job will be based in the Dining Room which is the main restaurant of the hotel. Breakfast is a big part of the At Six experience and we are looking for candidates with a genuine, warm personality and a passion for very attentive service. During lunch service you will be involved in serving one of the most exciting food menus in Stockholm alongside a diverse wine list. You will play a key role in the creation of unique and memorable experiences for our guests. Together with the kitchen team, you will be responsible for assuring we exceed guest ́s expectations at all times. Working hours are in the morning and days of the week may vary. You need to be a morning person as some shifts start as early as 5.30am.
   

  

*Our philosophy is that every detail makes a difference, and the differences make all the details!*
**And what about you?**
 You have experience working in a similar position at a high end restaurant and/or hotel. You are an organized team player who thrives in meeting all guests with a warm welcome and delivering exceptional service. You appreciate working in a high-pace environment with varied responsibilities. You’re communicative and appreciate meeting new people, both guests and colleagues, and speak English and Swedish, additional languages are beneficial.
   

  

 To recap, do you have all of the below skills?
   

  

* Experience in a similar role
* Al-a-carte experience
* Good barista skills and some wine, beer, and spirit knowledge
* Service is your passion and you have a genuine passion for food and beverage!
* Speaks Swedish and English, additional languages are a plus


**Let’s get to the good stuff;**
 Our employees, or as we like to call them; our ambassadors, make us who we are. This means we are diverse, reliant and impeccably service minded. As an employer, At Six is encouraging, humble and fun (no really, we are). Here, you will work in a beautiful and inspiring environment with people who you’ll soon call dear friends or empowering mentors. We strive to provide good opportunities for career growth.
   

  

 And to top it off,
   

  

***4 free***
 hotel nights at any Strawberry hotel
   

  

 Employee and Friends & Family room rates
   

  

 Discounts on food and drink for you and your friends
   

  

**Along With Additional Benefits**
 In this day and age, sustainability is most likely something you value. Luckily, so do we. Through the programme We Care, all Strawberry hotels make sure to facilitate an environment where our employees and planet thrive.
   

  

**Join us!**
 There! With all the mandatory stuff out of the way, let’s talk. Face to face, preferably. Apply below and don’t hesitate to send our Breakfast & Minibar Manager Fahad Chowdhury an email at fahad.chowdhury@hotelatsix.com if you have any questions.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis and the position can be filled before the last application date. So—what are you waiting for? Apply now!

title: Projektingenjör Tekniska system Tvärförbindelse Södertörn
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Government Administration, and Truck Transportation
description:
Som projektingenjör på Trafikverket är du med och underlättar vardagen för invånare och företagare i hela Sverige. Det gör du genom att vara med och bidra till framtidens infrastruktur.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Tvärförbindelse Södertörn ska bli en säker, smidig och hållbar mötesfri motortrafikled med separat cykel- och gångväg mellan Kungens kurva och Jordbro. En fjärdedel av den 20 kilometer långa sträckan kommer att gå i tunnlar. Vägen är en viktig pusselbit i den yttre tvärleden runt Stockholm och skapar möjligheter för utveckling i en starkt växande region. Vill du vara med på denna spännande resa?
   

  

 Som projektingenjör hos oss får du en unik möjlighet att med stort eget ansvar arbeta med ett av Sveriges största infrastrukturprojekt. Projektingenjören arbetar nära projektledaren och är en viktig del av projektledningsteamet. Du kommer att tillhöra Tvärförbindelse Södertörns Stab men kommer att arbeta i Sektion Installation. Sektion Installation ansvarar för projektering, montage och driftsättning av programmets tekniska system i tunnlar och på väg. De tekniska systemen utgör en central del i motortrafikledens framtida funktion och säkerställer att trafikanterna kan färdas i anläggningen på ett säkert och effektivt sätt, samt att Trafikverket kan utföra ett effektivt underhåll under anläggningens hela livslängd. De tekniska systemen delas in i följande delsystem, styr- och övervakningssystem, telesystem, trafiksystem, VA-system, IT/OT-system, radiosystem, brandbekämpningssystem, elkraft, belysning, allmän ventilation och tunnelventilation.
   

  

 Som projektingenjör får du en central roll i att stötta projektledaren i projektets samtliga faser. Ditt arbete kommer att omfatta:
   

  

* Utveckling och optimering av arbetssätt genom DevOps.
* Administration, handläggning och uppföljning av projektets olika delar, inklusive tid, kostnad och risk.
* Deltagande i projektmöten och upphandlingar.
* Arbeta med kontraktsinnehåll samt uppföljning av leverantörer, konsulter och entreprenörer.


 Du kommer att bistå en eller flera projektledare genom att stödja i planering, administration och uppföljning av faktorer såsom tid, kostnad, innehåll, risker, resurser, kvalitet, säkerhet, miljö och arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 I rollen ingår även att hantera interna och externa kontakter samt medverka vid möten med leverantörer och andra intressenter. Du kommer att ansvara för att ta fram underlag för uppföljning av leveranser från leverantörer, konsulter och entreprenörer.
   

  

 Vid behov kommer du även att driva vissa delar av projekt självständigt samt leda mindre projekt i sin helhet.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vem är du?
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som projektingenjör har du en god samarbetsförmåga och gillar att samarbeta med andra. Rollen har många kontaktytor och du samarbetar både internt och externt. Du är van vid att arbeta enligt en tydlig process, strukturerar och planerar ditt arbete väl. Du har en god analytisk problemlösningsförmåga och tar gärna egna initiativ när du ser vad som behöver göras och agerar därefter. Du är även flexibel och kan anpassa dig efter förändrade förutsättningar och nya utmaningar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har en högskole-/universitetsutbildning inom systemvetenskap, datateknik eller elektroteknik minst (180hp) alternativt annan utbildning i kombination med erfarenhet som vi bedömer som likvärdig
* har arbetat med eller gått kurs inom agila utvecklingsmetoder/ agil projektledning
* har goda kunskaper i svenska, i både tal och skrift
* har mycket god datorvana och kunskaper i alla delar av Office-paketet


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* har relevant erfarenhet av arbete inom ekonomi
* har relevant erfarenhet av riskhantering
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta med DevOps eller Jira


**Övrig information**
 Tjänsten kommer att vara placerad på vårat projektkontor i Flemmingsberg.
   

  

 Vi använder främst mail (från mejladress: noreply@heroma.se) för att göra utskick och kallelser. Kolla din inkorg och även skräppost/SPAM regelbundet under denna tid för att vara säker på att du får all information från oss!
   

  

 Önskar du att arbeta delvis på distans? I den här tjänsten kan det finnas möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till 40 procent av din arbetstid.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör. Om det inte står något annat i annonsen vill vi att du bifogar ditt CV. Vi har slutat begära in personligt brev eftersom vi inte har med det som del av urvalsunderlaget. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ska du kontakta ansvarig chef för rekryteringen så att din ansökan blir hanterad enligt särskilda rutiner. Du hittar namn och kontaktuppgifter till chefen i annonsen.
   

  

 Inom Stora projekt leder vi flera av Trafikverkets allra största investeringsprojekt . Vi arbetar med helheten - från planläggning och byggnation till färdig väg eller järnväg. Hela tiden med fokus på smarta lösningar och effektiv projektledning. Hos oss arbetar du med kollegor och olika intressenter, alla med sina kunskaper och erfarenheter, för att skapa hållbara transportlösningar.
   

  

 På Trafikverket jobbar vi med att göra Sverige närmare. Vi tror på att en förening av olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och perspektiv är den bästa grunden för att bygga en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering och en miljö där alla trivs och gör sitt bästa. Vi tror på mångfald där den gemensamma nämnaren är pålitlighet, engagemang och mod. För det är så vi bäst representerar vårt samhälle.

title: Medical Scientific Advisor for Respiratory & Immunology (COPD) in Stockholm – Nordic Marketing Company
description:
Our AstraZeneca Nordic Marketing Company employs around 550 people and has offices located in Oslo, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Espoo. AstraZeneca Nordic is a recognized leader in its core therapy areas and strives to improve the lives of millions of people. This is an area where you are free to be more – you are encouraged to challenge traditional ways and test your curiosity. We drive innovative science, deliver key launches, build close collaboration and partnerships within health care. In parallel to a growing portfolio and new indications, we are aiming to shape the transformation of our organization.
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Medical Scientific Advisor (MSA) for our Respiratory & Immunology (COPD) team in Sweden** 
 . This field-based position offers the opportunity to lead medical strategy for pre-launch and launch activities, collaborate with external stakeholders, and drive scientific leadership in COPD. The MSA will report to the Therapeutic Area Lead (TAL) Sweden and work closely with cross-functional teams within AstraZeneca to shape strategic initiatives that improve patient outcomes.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Medical and Scientific Engagement
   

  

  

* External Stakeholder Interaction: Develop and maintain relationships with Key External Experts (KEEs), healthcare professionals (HCPs), and medical organizations to enhance scientific exchange and gather insights.
+ Implement plans aligned with the medical strategy and lead scientific discussions in advisory boards, meetings, and educational programs.
+ Respond to unsolicited medical information requests about AZ assets.


 Pre-Launch and Launch Support
   

  

  

* Pre-Launch Strategy: Lead scientific efforts to prepare for new product introductions by identifying unmet medical needs and contributing to product strategies.
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the launch strategy is informed by scientific data and external stakeholder insights.

* Launch Activities: Execute medical activity plans, ensure alignment with healthcare practices, and support treatments to reach eligible patients after approval.


 Therapeutic Area Leadership & Transforming Care
   

  

  

* COPD Expertise: Serve as the subject matter expert in COPD, identifying clinical trends, evidence gaps, and unmet needs in the disease area.
+ Lead initiatives to transform care for COPD patients by leveraging insights into clinical practices and treatment pathways.

* Transforming Care Strategy: Co-lead programs that strive to deliver value to patients, healthcare systems, and AstraZeneca by integrating innovative strategies into clinical practice.


 Cross-Functional Collaboration
   

  

  

* Internal Collaboration: Work closely with Medical Affairs, SM&M, Clinical Development, Market Access, Commercial and Regulatory Affairs to provide scientific input into product development, regulatory strategies, and market access plans.
+ Provide feedback on clinical trial design, feasibility, and site engagement to optimize recruitment and retention in COPD trials.


 Externally Sponsored Research (ESR) & Innovation
   

  

  

* Support ESR and Open Innovation programs by identifying collaborative opportunities to generate real-world evidence and clinical insights that advance the scientific understanding of COPD.


**Qualifications & Experience**
* Education: Advanced degree (MD, PhD, MSc) in a relevant scientific or medical field. Experience in respiratory medicine, internal medicine or immunology is highly desirable.
* Experience:
+ Proven experience in medical affairs or clinical research, with a focus on respiratory diseases and COPD experience is preferred.
+ Experience in leading scientific communications, developing relationships with external experts, and executing pre-launch and launch activities.

* Skills:
+ Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex scientific data clearly and effectively to both internal and external stakeholders.
+ Strong collaboration and cross-functional teamwork abilities.
+ Knowledge of regulatory and medical affairs processes, including the drug development lifecycle.
+ Ability to support team development.


**Inclusion & Diversity**
 We are proud to have a unique workplace culture that inspires innovation and collaboration! Here, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives - and are made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity.
   

  

**Why AstraZeneca**
 At AstraZeneca, we are empowered to be brave and freely express our views. Our open and inclusive environment encourages everyone to communicate and share their ideas with purpose and confidence. We change the practice of medicine by generating compelling medical evidence that helps physicians better treat patients at every point in their journey. Our culture of openness, transparency, ambition, and drive makes it a supportive place to grow your career. We work together to improve lives, making the biggest possible impact for patients, science, and society.
   

  

**Ready to make a difference?**
 Apply today and join us in our mission to redefine COPD treatment.
   

  

 Welcome with your application in English, latest by
 **April 8th 2025**
 Where can I find out more?
   

  

 Our social media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/
   

  

 Inclusion & diversity: https://careers.astrazeneca.com/inclusion-diversity
   

  

 Career site: https://careers.astrazeneca.com
   

  

 Local website The Nordic Marketing Company

title: Sustainable Finance Research Analyst - German Speaking
description:
Let’s be #BrilliantTogether
   

  

**Overview**
 The Sustainable Finance Research team of ISS-Corporate is seeking a specialist to join its team based in Stockholm. This unit oversees providing critical sustainability opinions on Green, Social and Sustainability-Linked Bonds and delivers training to various Debt Capital Market stakeholders looking to advance their ESG strategy. This position offers in depth exposure to environmental and social topics and to various stakeholders driving the development of sustainable finance. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work highly independently, contribute to product and methodology development, and to support the high growth of the business. Successful candidates will have a passion for sustainability, enjoy fast-paced and multicultural team work, and have a strong analytical and critical mindset. The successful candidate will interact daily with colleagues in our global team and with clients from around the globe.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Lead and support second party opinion (SPO) and external review projects by conducting ESG analysis of Green, Social and Sustainability-Linked Bonds including assessment of the strategy of bond issuers, managing client relationship and producing reports
* Contribute to product and methodology developments
* Support interactions with the Sales team on technical requests
* Produce content related to Sustainable Bonds


**Qualifications**
* A minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience relating to sustainability/ESG consulting, environmental/climate consulting or capital markets is required
* Advanced university degree ideally in environmental science or law, engineering, finance, economics, international relations.
* Demonstrated interest in sustainability in general and specific knowledge in Green & Social Bonds, sustainable finance or analysis of corporate sustainability strategy is a requirement
* Experience with sustainable finance regulation and taxonomies (EU Taxonomy, CBI, EU Green Bond Standard, CSRD etc.) is a plus
* Excellent analytical skills and sharp attention to details
* Very strong project management / organizational skills & track-record in meeting deadlines for multi-stakeholder projects
* Excellent oral and written command of German and English is required
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with customer-first attitude
* Experience in working successfully in client facing roles is a plus


 #ICS #ANALYST
   

  

**What You Can Expect From Us**
 Our people are the moving force behind ISS STOXX. We are dedicated to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry and empowering them with the resources and support to enhance their career, health, financial and personal well-being.
   

  

 We are committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. We are invested in our people and are working every day to ensure a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace.
   

  

 Let’s empower, collaborate, and inspire one another.
   

  

 Let’s be
 **#BrilliantTogether** 
 .
   

  

**About ISS STOXX**
 ISS STOXX GmbH is a leading provider of research and technology solutions for the financial market. Established in 1985, we offer top-notch benchmark and custom indices globally, helping clients identify investment opportunities and manage portfolio risks. Our services cover corporate governance, sustainability, cyber risk, and fund intelligence. Majority-owned by Deutsche Börse Group, ISS STOXX has over 3,400 professionals in 33 locations worldwide, serving around 6,400 clients, including institutional investors and companies focused on ESG, cyber, and governance risk. Clients trust our expertise to make informed decisions for their stakeholders' benefit.
   

  

 ISS Corporate Solutions, Inc. (“ISS-Corporate”) is a leading provider of cutting-edge SaaS and high-touch advisory services to companies, globally. Companies turn to ISS-Corporate for expertise in designing and managing governance, compensation, sustainability, and cyber risk programs that align with company goals, reduce risk, and manage the needs of a diverse shareholder base by delivering data, tools, and advisory services. ISS-Corporate’s global client base extends across North America, Europe, and Asia, as well as other established and emerging markets worldwide.
   

  

 The Swedish Confederation of Professional Associations (SACO) is a politically independent central organization for 22 unions comprising university graduates in Sweden. You are welcome to contact the local representatives of SACO at ISS-Ethix on SACO@iss-esg.com. However, note that no applications sent to this e-mail address will be accepted.
   

  

*Institutional Shareholder Services (“ISS”) is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. It is our policy to prohibit discrimination or harassment against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, creed, religion, sex, age, height, weight, citizenship status, national origin, social origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, pregnancy status, marital status, familial status, mental or physical disability, veteran status, military service or status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law (referred to as “protected status”). All activities including, but not limited to, recruiting and hiring, recruitment advertising, promotions, performance appraisals, training, job assignments, compensation, demotions, transfers, terminations (including layoffs), benefits, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment, are and will be administered on a non-discriminatory basis, consistent with all applicable federal, state, and local requirements.*

title: Summer Intern - Management
description:
Agteria is slowing down global warming in the most effective way - by reducing methane emissions from cattle. Our 
 
 novel, patent-pending methane inhibitor
 
  blocks methane production in cows with 
 
 less than 1g per day
 
 . We’re on a mission to cut 
 
 1% of the world’s greenhouse gases
 
 , and this summer, you can be part of it.
 



  





 As a 
 
 Summer Intern
 
 , you’ll work hands-on across the business - shaping strategies, driving initiatives, and unlocking market potential. You’ll 
 
 learn fast, move fast,
 
  and collaborate with top innovators and investors within the 
 
 Norrsken ecosystem
 
  - because at Agteria, 
 
 speed and impact are everything
 
 .
 



  





**Management Intern** 




**As a management intern, your responsibilities will include:** 



* Conduct research and analysis on industry trends, market opportunities, competitor landscapes, and regulatory changes to inform strategic decision-making
* Support the funding team in financing activities such as grant applications and fundraising to ensure long-term financial stability
* Compile and organize data, reports, and other information to support business planning, marketing and product development efforts
* Provide administrative support to the team including scheduling meetings, organizing documents, and creating structure
* Support the team in marketing and employer branding activities such as content creation, campaign planning, and event coordination to enhance brand visibility
* Build materials for commercial and marketing purposes, including presentations, website, and visual assets
* Assist with day-to-day tasks and operations to ensure smooth and efficient functioning of the team



  





**We are looking for the following qualifications:** 



* You are currently enrolled or recently completed a Bachelor's or Master's degree program in Economics, Business Administration, Industrial Engineering or related field
* Project management skills with track record of starting, running and managing projects and areas independently and successfully
* Strong interest in entrepreneurship and startups
* Excellent analytical thinking
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English



  





**Why Join Agteria?** 



* **Impact:** 
  Join a mission-driven team dedicated to driving positiv impact on the planet's future.
* **Culture:** 

 Thrive in an innovative, collaborative, and inclusive work environment within the Norrsken community and in the inspiring co-working space in central Stockholm, surrounded by impact entrepreneurs.
* **Growth:** 
  We are scaling quickly and there will be ample opportunities for personal learning and development.



  





**Recruitment Process** 




 We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we review applications on a rolling basis.
 


* This is a role based in our office in Stockholm between June and August, with exact dates to be discussed.
* You will need to possess a valid work permit for working legally in the European Union and Sweden.
* Agteria wishes to attract, recruit and retain a diverse, inclusive and creative workforce. We actively encourage applications from all groups and communities

title: Thesis Project at Sandvik
job_function: Administrative, Human Resources, and Customer Service
description:
Are you excited to shape the innovations of tomorrow? Then we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 We’re looking for bachelors, masters or higher vocational education workers for our sites in Sandviken, Gimo, Stockholm, and Svedala in Sweden. We offer you versatile tasks in a modern and continuously evolving international environment – a great opportunity for building strong networks and for your personal and professional development!
   

  

**Why do your thesis work with us?**
 We want to show how interesting and versatile a global company can be and want to give you a glimpse of what it’s like to work with top products and exceptional professionals in the manufacturing industry. We offer thesis projects on many different topics and disciplines in engineering and industrial management. If you already have an idea, please attach it along with your resume when applying.
   

  

 Thesis work at Sandvik Group can give you new perspectives and contribute to your personal growth while translating your theoretical knowledge into real work. These projects are important to us too, as they contribute to our business while we get to know dedicated, talented students that may become future co-workers!
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik Group, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further. Check out this YouTube video to learn more about our purpose: Advancing the world through engineering.
   

  

**How to apply?**
 Send your application no later than May 31, 2025. When applying together with someone, please submit only one joined application per thesis work. Job ID: R0074704.
