All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .
   

  

 Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Partner Development Manager
description:
**Partner Development Manager - Sweden
   

  

**About AvePoint:****
 Beyond Secure. AvePoint is the global leader in data security, governance, and resilience, going beyond traditional solutions to ensure a robust data foundation and enable organizations everywhere to collaborate with confidence. Over 25,000 customers worldwide rely on the AvePoint Confidence Platform to prepare, secure, and optimize their critical data across Microsoft, Google, Salesforce, and other collaboration environments. AvePoint’s global channel partner program includes approximately 5,000 managed service providers, value-added resellers, and systems integrators, with our solutions available in more than 100 cloud marketplaces. To learn more, visit www.avepoint.com.
   

  

 At AvePoint, we are committed to investing in our people. Agility, passion and teamwork set us up to do our best work and foster a culture where you are empowered to craft your career, make an impact, and own (y)our future. Unleash the power of you!
   

  

****Overview****
 AvePoint is seeking a Partner Development Manager to recruit, convert, and enable prospective MSP’s and VAR partners. In this role, you will be responsible for prospecting, qualifying, building partner relationships, and other elements of the presales cycle leading to transaction and sell through to the partners customer base.
   

  

 We are looking for creative thinkers who are confident and self-motivated with an entrepreneurial mindset. You take pride in seeing your hard work pay off when you see the final results and are determined to help others succeed.
   

  

****Your Responsibilities Will Include:****
* Proactively source new prospects
* Nurture, cross-sell and upsell existing MSP Partners
* Collaborate with cross-functional team members in different territories to execute sales plays and build local relationships to drive results
* Partner Sourced Revenue Target Achievement


**OK, I'm interested… is this job for me?**
 We look for people who value agility, passion and teamwork; those who can bring fresh ideas to the table and want the opportunity to learn, grow, and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build upon what you do best for our customers, partners, team, and you.
   

  

**Other qualities you'll need to be a fit for this role include:**
* 2-3 years previous partner management experience in the SaaS hemisphere
* BA/BS in Business, Marketing, Communications, or similar relevant field
* Strong communication skills to articulate company vision, product changes, and adapting to new strategies - must be business fluent in Swedish & English
* Ability to execute in an environment where priorities change quickly, demonstrating agility, adaptability, and problem solving skills
* Entrepreneurial mindset and detail oriented


****About AvePoint****
 AvePoint is proud to employ talent from many different backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that diversity and inclusion drives our success and is at the core of how we hire, communicate, and collaborate to deliver value and excellence. We are committed to fostering an environment where people can bring their whole selves to work and feel a sense of belonging, and we continue to work toward creating a workforce that represents the diversity of our customers and communities.
   

  

 Any personal data you share with us during the application process will be processed strictly in compliance with applicable data protection laws and our Privacy Notice.

title: Salesforce Architect
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
* Be a productive member of the team.


 Requirements
 * Lead product vision, stakeholder engagement, backlog management, requirement definition, product roadmap planning, sprint planning, system integration, user acceptance testing, release management, risk management, and feedback loops.
* Create the Business Requirements Specification (BRS) document based on feasibility outcomes.
* Advise and mentor diverse teams, including both customer and TCS resources, offering guidance on application and integration development best practices, as well as providing technical product support.
* Conduct requirement gathering and discovery sessions with key stakeholders to understand business needs, document functional requirements, and map them to various Salesforce CRM, CPQ, and CLM capabilities.
* Develop acceptance criteria for features prioritized by the business and support teams, and break down features into Salesforce-specific user stories.
* Coordinate with the implementation team during the solution design phase to ensure alignment with business requirements.
* Strong Salesforce Techno-Functional knowledge (Sales & Service Process).
* Proficiency in Swedish.
* Telecom BSS functional knowledge or Telecom industry experience.
* Experience with Salesforce Communication Cloud.
* Proficiency in requirement gathering, process design, and conducting workshops with business stakeholders.


 Benefits
 * A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Experienced technology solution professional – in Stockholm or Gothenburg
description:
Do you want to be a part of shaping Valcon as a premium technology consulting firm in Sweden? Do you have 8 years of experience in consulting and/or other relevant roles? And are you passionate about creating lasting results for clients? Then you could be our new colleague.
   

  

 Valcon is a leading European management consulting firm with Scandinavian roots and an informal, inclusive culture. With offices in the Netherlands, Denmark, the UK, Sweden, Germany, Croatia and Serbia, we strive to connect strategy with operations through innovative technology and data. We are looking for an experienced and curious individual who values collaboration and thrives in dynamic, diverse environments.
   

  

**Experience**
* 8 years of experience in technology consulting or other relevant roles
* A relevant Master’s degree
* A thoughtful approach to leadership


**Keywords**
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* A commercial mindset


**Location** 
 : Sweden
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As a Experienced technology solution professional at Valcon, you will:
   

  

* Be part of the digital advisory team in one of the fastest-growing consultancies in Europe
* Contribute to our exciting growth journey while contributing to our expanding presence in the Swedish market
* Work side by side with skilled and experienced colleagues in diverse and international teams, tackling challenges from digital strategies to IT implementations
* Solve complex problems for Swedish and international companies across industries, guiding them to unlock the full potential of their data
* Help clients become more data-driven, comply with laws and regulations regarding their data and help them get the most value out of their data


**Can you say yes to the following?**
* 8 years of experience in technology consulting or other relevant role
* A relevant Master’s degree
* A strong understanding of industry standards, best practices and emerging trends in technology, such as Intelligent Automation, Process Mining, ERP systems, low code, AI and cloud
* Hands-on expertise in designing scalable, secure and high-performing technology solutions aligned with client needs
* Proficiency in leading-edge tools and platforms such as Celonis, Appian, Mendix, specializing in Intelligent Automation solutions
* Experience in defining project specifications, establish technical frameworks and ensure solution quality through robust standards and procedures.
* Experienced in leading system enhancements, guide teams in resolving technical challenges and identify operational risks and redundancies.
* Experience from comprehensive assessments to develop innovative technical solutions that drive efficiency and deliver impactful results
* A commercial mindset with a proven track record in uncovering growth opportunities, building strong client relationships and selling complex technical assignments
* A thoughtful approach to leadership with the ability to guide and mentor project teams effectively
* Relevant certifications in IT management, project management (e.g., PMP), and digital transformation (e.g., CDT). ITL, Microsoft and Cloud are a plus.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in both Swedish and English with the ability to translate technical concepts for a variety of stakeholders


**We offer you**
 At Valcon, we believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels valued and respected. We offer:
   

  

* A diverse and international workplace with an informal culture and a flat hierarchy
* The opportunity to collaborate across business areas and levels and work closely with some of the most talented and experienced consultants in the industry
* A focus on professional and personal growth, supported by our value-driven culture, which is grounded in Integrity, Together, Joy, Curious, and Can Do
* Enhanced benefits and support throughout all life stages, including maternity, paternity and adoption leave, health and well-being initiatives and resources for navigating significant life transitions
* A welcoming office environment in either Stockholm (Kungsgatan 9) or Gothenburg (Kungsportsavenyen 21)


 We care deeply about results, but we care even more about people. At Valcon, you’ll find a workplace that values excellence and ingenuity while keeping grounded in the reality of delivering lasting results for our clients.
   

  

**Application**
 Does this sound like the right opportunity for you? If so, we encourage you to apply below. For any questions or additional information, feel free to reach out to [email protected].
   

  

 We are reviewing applications and conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, so please send us your application as soon as possible.

title: Senior Vice President, Corporate Solutions
description:
The Apex Group was established in Bermuda in 2003 and is now one of the world’s largest fund administration and middle office solutions providers.
   

  

 Our business is unique in its ability to reach globally, service locally and provide cross-jurisdictional services. With our clients at the heart of everything we do, our hard-working team has successfully delivered on an unprecedented growth and transformation journey, and we are now represented by over circa 13,000 employees across 112 offices worldwide.Your career with us should reflect your energy and passion.
   

  

 That’s why, at Apex Group, we will do more than simply ‘empower’ you. We will work to supercharge your unique skills and experience.
   

  

 Take the lead and we’ll give you the support you need to be at the top of your game. And we offer you the freedom to be a positive disrupter and turn big ideas into bold, industry-changing realities.
   

  

 For our business, for clients, and for you
   

  

**Senior Vice President, Corporate Solutions**
**Role Location: Apex Sweden**
 Department: Corporate Solutions
   

  

 Employment Type: Permanent, Full Time
   

  

**The Role**
 This is a senior operational role within the Corporate Solutions pillar of Apex and has a wide array of responsibilities including, but not limited to, leading a function with responsibility for delivering governance, fiduciary, accounting and administration support.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage direct onshore reports and work closely with offshore indirect reports to ensure a high quality and excellently co-ordinated service is delivered to client relationships
* Providing technical support to the administration team on all aspects of client service, particularly with respect to financial accounting and tax
* Oversee the full lifecycle management of corporate structures, from incorporation and formation, to include adherence to AML, day-to-day administration, domiciliation, financial accounting, cash management, and payment processing
* Establish, cultivate and manage strong relationships and networks with intermediaries and internal contacts,
* Lead the Corporate Solutions function locally with responsibility for the development and leadership of the team members
* Attend industry training as is required to ensure that you have and maintain the appropriate technical knowledge required to perform your role and to understand the regulatory obligations to which you are subject to
* Prepare monthly performance reports on service delivery for Group-level review
* Reviewing and preparation of annual financial statements to required standard and deadlines
* Performing and overseeing ongoing accounting activities to ensure accuracy, compliance, and timely reporting.
* Review transaction documents to ensure adherence to regulatory requirements
* To obtain internal and external stakeholder feedback and drive increases in client satisfaction and engagement
* Ensure the timely and accurate resolution of any internal or external issues and ensure effective open and clear communication processes are in place
* Continuously challenge existing practices by promoting efficient use of our systems and processes to enable growth and facilitate the expansion of our capabilities
* To understand relevant accounting standards, laws, practices, treaties, and regulations that underpin our client requirements
* Establish and maintain sound motivational people management practices. Ensure employee development is aligned to business objectives and oversee and measure effective work processes and practices within the team
* Review service delivery against the client fee structure and escalation service creep where applicable
* Coordinating with our Sales team when identifying new business opportunities and or the development of our services
* Any other duties in the scope of the role that the company requires


**Skills required:**
* A minimum of 5 years overall experience in a similar role and at least two years’ experience acting on client entity boards
* A professional accounting qualification and good understanding of both local and international accounting standards and tax regulation
* A track record of developing revenue from new and existing clients
* Excellent networking, communication, organisational and leadership skills
* Proven ability to build and manage a team
* A good understanding of Swedish company law and other related legal and regulatory requirements as well as a working knowledge of relevant Swedish tax issues
* A keen awareness of risk issues in the context of fiduciary responsibilities
* Motivated and driven with an ability to work under pressure to tight deadlines and demanding financial targets
* A willingness to travel as business needs dictate
* An ability to embrace and execute change while providing support to employees through the process


*The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed. They are not construed as an exhaustive list of all deliverables, responsibilities and duties. All Apex employees are expected to be flexible in approach and may be required to perform other duties as may be reasonably required for the benefit of the Company, and to add value.*
 Disclaimer: Unsolicited CVs sent to Apex (Talent Acquisition Team or Hiring Managers) by recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position. Apex operates a direct souring model and where agency assistance is required, the Talent Acquisition team will engage directly with our exclusive recruitment partners.

title: Social Media Project Leader, IKEA Stockholm Barkarby
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta som social media manager eller liknande? Vill du driva IKEA Barkarbys kommersiella agenda för sociala medier framåt och inspirera våra kunder genom sociala kanaler för att skapa en ännu bättre kundupplevelse? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig! Vi söker nu en projektledare för våra sociala medier.
   

  

 Vi tror att du kommer att trivas hos oss om du:
   

 • Har ett stort intresse för att leda den kommersiella agendan genom våra sociala medier.
   

 • Är en trygg och självgående person som vågar ta egna initiativ och beslut samt prioritera ditt arbete.
   

 • Vill skapa kreativt content för både medarbetare och kunder.
   

 • Tycker om att samarbeta, träffa nya människor och bygga relationer.
   

 • Har ett starkt självledarskap för att kunna utveckla rollen självständigt.
   

 • Är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och ser möjligheter i utmaningar.
   

 • Kommunicerar på ett tydligt, ärligt och engagerande sätt.
   

 • Har ett intresse för heminredning och delar IKEAs värderingar.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har utbildning och/eller erfarenhet inom sociala medier samt erfarenhet av Adobe Creative Cloud och att hantera professionell kamerautrustning. Du ska kunna kommunicera på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

**EN DAG I DITT LIV MED OSS** 
  

 När du arbetar hos oss på IKEA är ingen dag den andra lik. Din huvudsakliga uppgift är att inspirera våra kunder genom att skapa content på sociala medier som förmedlar våra heminredningslösningar på ett överraskande och engagerande sätt. Du planerar och följer upp innehåll, både rörligt och stillbildsmaterial. Det är din uppgift att skapa inspirerande material som engagerar våra kunder och bidrar till en spännande och relevant digital upplevelse.
   

  

 I din roll som Social Media Project Leader kommer du att arbeta självständigt med dina uppdrag, samtidigt som du samarbetar med kollegor över hela varuhuset. Eftersom du jobbar i en butiksmiljö kommer arbetsdagen ibland att vara snabbt växlande och kräva snabba beslut. Dina arbetsdagar kommer att vara fyllda med kreativitet och variation, där du är hands-on i ditt arbete med allt från att fota, filma, ljussätta, redigera och publicera content. Du kommer även att arbeta fram strategier för content och planera innehåll efter vår kommersiella kalender. Du kommer också att hålla i live-shopping, vilket innebär att du behöver vara bekväm både framför och bakom kameran, samt hosta event och stötta vid speciella tillfällen. Du kommer även att skapa innehåll och kommunikation internt för våra medarbetare. Till din hjälp har du 10h/v en kollega som stöttar arbetet med våra sociala medieplattformar.
   

  

**OM DETTA ARBETSOMRÅDE** 
  

 Tjänsten vi erbjuder är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning, om inte redan är anställd på IKEA. Startdatum enligt överenskommelse. Arbetstid vardagar 8-17 med flextid, visst helgarbete förekommer. Tjänsten tillhör Unionen och tjänstemannaavtalet.
   

  

 På IKEA erbjuder vi förmåner i form av personalrabatt, friskvårdsbidrag, hälsokonto och ett bonusprogram för alla våra anställda. Men framför allt erbjuder IKEA dig är en arbetsplats där det finns en stark tro på dig som medarbetare. Vi är en arbetsplats där det finns olika sätt att växa på. När du växer, växer också IKEA!
   

  

  

 Ansök med CV via www.ikea.se/jobb
   

 Du kommer även att få svara på några frågor vid ansökningstillfället. Går du vidare väntar videopresentation, intervju, arbetsprov och referenstagning. Vår kommunikation sker främst via mejl, så håll koll på din inkorg och skräppost.
   

  

 Vi uppmuntrar och välkomnar varmt ansökningar från människor från alla kulturer, bakgrunder och erfarenheter eftersom vi vet att mångfald inom IKEA gör oss starkare. Har du frågor eller behöver någon särskild anpassning i rekryteringsprocessen? Vänligen kontakta mig: sofia.remison1@ingka.ikea.com
   

  

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan! Sista ansökningsdag är 8/4 2025.

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Associate Managing Consultant - Strategy & Transformation-R-238888
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Associate Managing Consultant - Strategy & Transformation
   

  

 Associate Managing Consultant – Strategy & Transformation
   

  

 Advisors & Consulting Services
   

  

 Services within Mastercard is responsible for acquiring, engaging, and retaining customers by managing fraud and risk, enhancing cybersecurity, and improving the digital payments experience. We provide value-added services and leverage expertise, data-driven insights, and execution. Our Advisors & Consulting Services team combines traditional management consulting with Mastercard’s rich data assets, proprietary platforms, and technologies to provide clients with powerful strategic insights and recommendations. Our teams work with a diverse global customer base across industries, from banking and payments to retail and restaurants.
   

  

 The Advisors & Consulting Services group has five specializations: Strategy & Transformation, Performance Analytics, Business Experimentation, Marketing, and Program Management. Our Strategy & Transformation consultants lead clients through impactful decision-making as they tackle strategic, tactical, operational, and transformational business challenges. They apply a broad set of problem-solving techniques to improve the client’s overall strategy, performance, and operations.
   

  

 Positions for different specializations and levels are available in separate job postings. Please review our consulting specializations to learn more about all opportunities and apply for the position that is best suited to your background and experience: https://careers.mastercard.com/us/en/consulting-specializations-at-mastercard
   

  

 Roles and Responsibilities
   

  

 Client Impact
   

  

* Manage deliverable development and workstreams on projects across a range of industries and problem statements
* Contribute to and/or develop strategies and programs for large, regional, and global clients by leveraging data and technology solutions to unlock client value
* Manage working relationship with client managers, and act as trusted and reliable partner


 Team Collaboration & Culture
   

  

* Develop sound business recommendations and deliver effective client presentations
* Plan, organize, and structure own work and that of junior project delivery consultants to identify effective analysis structures to address client problems, synthesize analyses into relevant findings, and create impactful storylines
* Lead team and external meetings, and lead or co-lead project management
* Contribute to the firm's intellectual capital and solution development
* Grow from coaching to enable ownership of day-to-day project management across client projects, and mentor junior consultants


**Qualifications**
 Basic qualifications
   

  

* Undergraduate degree with work experience in consulting, corporate strategy, business intelligence, business line management, or product management
* Experience managing clients or internal stakeholders
* Logical, structured thinking, and affinity for numerical analysis
* Advanced Word, Excel, and PowerPoint skills
* Ability to perform multiple tasks with multiple clients in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
* Ability to communicate effectively in English and the local office language (if applicable)
* Eligibility to work in the country where you are applying, as well as apply for travel visas as required by travel needs


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience managing tasks or workstreams in a collaborative team environment with third parties
* Experience coaching junior delivery consultants
* Relevant industry expertise
* MBA or master’s degree with relevant specialization (not required)


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.


 R-238888

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**
*This role is based in Stockholm with the expectation of working from the office a few days a week.*
 As a Senior Data Analyst specializing in Decision Analytics, you will leverage advanced analytical techniques and data-driven methods to provide comprehensive insights into business performance across the entire organization. Your deliveries will guide impactful decision-making by taking into account complex dependencies of various business areas. You will work independently and proactively, identifying analytics needs throughout the company and scoping initiatives to deliver tangible value from data.
   

  

 This role emphasizes close collaboration with both fellow Data Analysts and Data Scientists, as well as senior stakeholders across all departments, translating complex data into clear, actionable recommendations that directly impact strategic decisions and fuel growth. If you're passionate about leveraging data to understand and improve business performance, and excel at communicating insights to diverse audiences, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Include**
* Act as a strategic partner to stakeholders across product, marketing, sales, and music teams, proactively identifying opportunities to leverage data for business improvement.
* Develop and deliver compelling data narratives that translate complex analyses into clear, actionable insights, fostering a data-driven culture throughout the organization.
* Build and maintain dashboards and reports that provide a holistic view of business performance, enabling stakeholders to track key metrics and make informed decisions.
* Conduct in-depth analyses to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, providing strategic recommendations that drive growth and optimize business processes.
* Use advanced analytics and statistical methods to analyze complex data sets and extract valuable insights.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
* 5+ years of experience in a data analysis role, with a proven track record of delivering impactful business insights.
* Strong proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and Python/R for data analysis.
* Experience with git version control, data modeling (eg. dbt) and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Power BI) and working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery).
* Experience in a role that required heavy interaction with non technical team members, and the successful translation of complex data to those teams.


**Soft Requirements**
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively translate complex data into clear and concise narratives for diverse audiences.
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships with stakeholders.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with a focus on delivering practical and actionable recommendations.
* Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methods, including hypothesis testing and regression analysis.
* A proactive and results-oriented mindset, with a passion for driving business value through data.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.


**Nice To Have**
* Experience in the music or entertainment industry, with a strong understanding of content licensing and digital rights management.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.

title: Engineering Manager - Site Reliability Engineering
description:
****Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.****
 We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead one of our core platform teams, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). In this role you’ll oversee the team’s people, processes, delivery, technical product, and cross-team collaborations. Collaborating closely with the team, neighbouring teams, and Staff Engineers, you’ll drive critical infrastructure that impacts the entire company.
   

  

 You’ll guide a collaborative, inclusive, and high-performing team that thrives on shared decision-making, knowledge-sharing, and fostering a psychologically safe environment. Your role will include refining team processes, building and prioritizing backlogs, clarifying requirements, and engaging with stakeholders across the company. Your experience in crafting technical platforms in other organizations will bring valuable insights, while your open-mindedness will help shape our approach.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
* Lead and grow a high-performing team by providing mentorship, coaching, and technical guidance while fostering a culture of collaboration, trust, and continuous improvement.
* Drive infrastructure excellence by ensuring the platform is scalable, reliable, and optimized for fast, efficient product delivery.
* Partner with other teams and stakeholders to align the platform’s development with organizational priorities and technical goals.
* Enhance team processes by refining workflows, prioritizing backlogs, and clarifying technical and product requirements to maximize efficiency and impact.
* Shape the vision for the platform’s future, inspiring the team to innovate and successfully bring that vision to life.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Solid technical background with expertise in modern SRE practices and cloud technology.
* Proven experience managing and growing SRE teams.
* Extensive understanding of technical platforms, team dynamics, software delivery and system design.
* Ability to foster a psychologically safe work environment for your team.


**It would also be music to our ears if you have**
* Experience with technical product development, focusing on Developer Experience.
* Hands-on familiarity with tools and technologies like Go/TypeScript, GKE, Terraform, Observability stacks, and CI/CD pipelines (ArgoCD, GitHub Actions).


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

 We embrace a hybrid work setup that offers the freedom and flexibility to balance your personal and professional life. At the same time, we value the collaboration, creativity, and connection that comes from spending the majority of our time together in the office. This approach allows us to innovate as a team while giving you the autonomy to work in a way that suits you best.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Strategic Account Manager
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Snabbväxande företag använder Upsales varje dag för att skala upp sin verksamhet där våra kunder i snitt växer sin försäljning med 22% efter ett års användning. Är du nyfiken på ett SaaS-bolag som har branschens högst rankade Customer Success-team?
   

  

 Välkommen till oss!
   

  

 Vi älskar att hjälpa snabbväxande B2B-företag att hitta nya potentiella kunder, vinna fler affärer och växa sina befintliga kunder. Eftersom att vi på Upsales nu fortsätter växa är vi ständigt på jakt efter nya talanger där vi alltid erbjuder ett nästa karriärsteg för dem som visar initiativ och levererar konsekventa resultat. Det som också definierar oss är vår gemenskap och drivkraft att utvecklas framåt som ett team.
   

  

***Varför du ska välja Upsales, våra Highlights***
* Vår kundbas har vuxit med 400% sedan 2019
* 77 kvartal i rad med tillväxt utan extern finansiering, utan lån och fortsatt majoritetsägd av ledningsgruppen
* 30%+ YoY lönsam tillväxt - sätter tonen för vår kultur och våra kärnvärden
* Tillgång till världens främsta utbildningsplattform för försäljning och ledarskap med 300+ kurser (live och on-demand)
* 1 % for the planet - varje år donerar Upsales 1 % av våra årliga intäkter till Solvatten och One Tree Planet


***Ditt uppdrag hos oss***
 Som Strategic Account Manager på Upsales blir det din uppgift att fokusera på fortsatt försäljning och utveckling av befintlig kundportfölj. I vardagen kommer du att identifiera och kontakta kunder med tillväxtpotential i din portfölj, boka möten, arrangera värdeskapande businesscases tillsammans med våra Solutions Engineers och underhålla avtal. Du har ett nära samarbete med Onboarding- och Customer Success-teamen som ser till att dina kunder får maximalt värde av våra produkter och tjänster.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt för dig att du utnyttjar din passion för affärer, hanterar hela försäljningsprocessen från start till mål, levererar nya upsale (ARR) och skapar starka relationer med dina kunder. Du arbetar ständigt nära försäljningsledning för att hitta nya sätt att attrahera och behålla kunder. Givetvis har du ditt fantastiska team av kollegor runt omkring dig som du växer och utvecklas med på daglig basis.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

*Vem är du:*
* För att lyckas i rollen som Strategic Account Manager behöver du vara handlingskraftig, motiverad, ambitiös och sträva efter att bygga din framtid på Upsales.
* Vi ser gärna att du har minst 3-5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av komplex B2B-försäljning och en utpräglad förmåga att framgångsrikt nå mål, bygga och behålla befintliga affärer från grunden
* Du lyckas skapa långsiktiga affärsrelationer med kunder på snabbväxande medelstora företag
* Det är viktigt att du har utmärkt kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska
* Du har ett affärssinne och kunskaper i försäljningsstrategi (MEDDIC)


***Vad vi erbjuder***
* Omfattande introduktions och karriärplan
* Tillgång till utbildningsplaner för ledarskap och försäljning
* Möjlighet att arbeta i ett skalbolag med internationell expansion
* En miljö med högt tempo med likasinnade ambitiösa personer
* Kvartalsvisa och årliga försäljningsutmärkelser

title: Nordic/Baltic Facilities Manager
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**What We Offer**
 Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
   

  

**Role Locations:**
 This Vacancy in open in 3 different locations:
   

  

**Finland** 
 -Espoo
   

  

**Denmark** 
 -Copenhagen
   

  

**Sweden** 
 -Stockholm
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 As an SAP Facilities Manager for the Nordic and Baltic countries, you will:
   

  

* Actively participate in the real estate lease negotiations with the local leadership and SAP real estate negotiation partners
* Collect required data and participate in the business case creation and approval process
* Ensure correct data in the lease contract database
* Represent facility operations at management level in the Nordics and Baltics, informing local directors on facility-related projects and ensuring business requirements are met.
* Lead, develop and support the local facilities teams in the countries and oversee outsourced building service contracts.
* Lead and support facilities fit out projects in the regions
* Manage all building service contracts effectively, ensuring facilities service levels are in line with GRF expectations and reporting on their effectiveness.
* Maintain local facilities service levels, fulfilling company’s Health and Safety obligations
* Collaborate with diverse global and local teams to implement sustainable practices and drive approved schemes.
* Negotiate facility service contracts with Global Purchasing colleagues and monitor, audit, report on the performance of existing contracts, aligning to Group purchasing policy.
* Work with Global Physical Security colleagues to maintain security standards.
* Lead the development of capital (CAPEX) and operating (OPEX) budgets, report on these budgets and drive improvements.
* Participate in the local crisis management teams


**What You Bring**
 As an applicant, you should possess:
   

  

* Minimum of 5 years’ experience of managing building services.
* Comprehensive understanding of Facilities budgeting, procedures, and reporting.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills with the ability to meet deadlines and embrace new challenges.
* Fluent English language skills and additionally at least one Scandinavian language.
* Knowledge of commercial contracts management and procurement.
* Proven experience in leading people and managing projects.
* Ability to lead a team in a cross-functional environment.
* Strong interpersonal, influencing and communication skills.
* Proficiency in handling multiple, high-priority jobs simultaneously.
* Resilience, quick-thinking and adaptability to changes.
* Ability to solve problems proactively and make sound decisions in a constantly changing environment.
* Excellent grasp of SAP and MS Office applications.


**Meet Your Team**
 As the SAP Facilities Manager in the Nordics and Baltics, you will be responsible for ensuring the Facilities and Real Estate Management of all our operations across the countries adhere to SAP Global standards. Your role will play a crucial part in partnering with business units based in the Nordic and Baltic regions. With over 800 colleagues spread across nine offices in the Nordics and Baltics, you will lead and collaborate with engaged and diverse teams, ensuring that our service delivery is of the highest quality. You will be reporting to the Real Estate and Facilities head for the UK, Ireland and Nordic countries, playing your part in our global operations.
   

  

**We are SAP**
 SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
   

  

**Our inclusion promise**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

title: Lösningsarkitekt inom Cloud med 4-5 års erfarenhet
description:
**Lösningsarkitekt inom Cloud till kund**
 Har du erfarenhet av molnlösningar och vill ta nästa steg i din karriär? Vår kund söker nu en lösningsarkitekt inom Cloud med 4–5 års erfarenhet. Detta är en spännande möjlighet för dig som vill arbeta med arkitektur och strategisk utveckling i en stabil och innovativ organisation.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som lösningsarkitekt inom Cloud hos vår kund får du en central roll i att forma och vidareutveckla deras molnbaserade lösningar. Du kommer att arbeta tätt med utvecklingsteam, verksamheten och IT-ledning för att säkerställa att molnstrategin stödjer affärsbehov och framtida krav.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Design och implementation av molnarkitektur med fokus på Azure.
* Stötta utvecklingsteamen med teknisk expertis och riktlinjer.
* Säkerställa hög prestanda, säkerhet och skalbarhet i molnlösningar.
* Identifiera och driva förbättringar inom molninfrastruktur och DevOps-processer.
* Samarbeta tvärfunktionellt och bidra till den tekniska strategin hos kunden.


**Vi erbjuder dig:**
* En nyckelroll i en affärskritisk IT-miljö med fokus på modernisering och innovation.
* En kultur som prioriterar lärande, kunskapsdelning och personlig utveckling.
* Ett positivt samarbetsklimat med stort fokus på innovation och kvalitet.
* En arbetsplats centralt i Stockholm, nära T-centralen.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har en akademisk examen eller motsvarande och 4–5 års erfarenhet av Cloud-lösningar.
* Har gedigen erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure.
* Har erfarenhet av att designa och implementera arkitektur för molnbaserade applikationer och plattformar.
* Har kunskap om DevOps, CI/CD och Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Har erfarenhet av API-design och integrationer.
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av säkerhetsaspekter inom cloud och regelefterlevnad.


**Ansökan** 
 Låter detta som en roll för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vid frågor, kontakta Tech Recruiter Olivia Holm på olivia.holm@nexergroup.com.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Lösningsarkitekt inom Business intelligence till Knowit i Stockholm
description:
Vill du arbeta med den senaste tekniken och forma framtidens BI- och datalösningar? På Knowit Datalytics söker vi en Lösningsarkitekt som vill kombinera strategi och teknik för att utveckla innovativa analytics-lösningar – med målet att skapa en bättre och mer hållbar framtid!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig:**
* En central och verksamhetskritisk roll där du arbetar med det senaste inom Microsoft ekosystem.
* En kreativ och stöttande arbetsmiljö med fokus på din personliga och professionella utveckling.
* Konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket med försäkring, pension, årsbonus och flexibla arbetstider.


**Om rollen och ditt team:**
 Hos Knowit Datalytics i Stockholm blir du en del av ett team om 50 skickliga specialister inom analytics och data management. Vi har en decentraliserad organisationsstruktur med snabba beslutsvägar, samtidigt som vi har kraften av en stor organisation med 4400 erfarna specialister i Sverige och Norden.
   

  

 Som lösningsarkitekt inom Business Intelligence arbetar du inom hela erbjudande- och leveranskedjan av analytics- och datamanagementlösningar, inklusive:
   

  

* Strategisk rådgivning, arkitektur och teknisk vägledning utifrån kundens behov.
* Design och implementation av analytics- och datamangement-lösningar
* Översätta behov till hållbara lösningar med kvalité och efterlevnad av IT- och säkerhetsföreskrifter


**Om dig:**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har ett antal års erfarenhet inom rollen som lösningsarkitekt med erfarenhet av Microsoft data management produkter och tjänster, både onprem och i molnet. Vidare har du en teknisk bredd inom ETL och Data warehouse med ett intresse att arbeta nära tekniken.
   

  

 Som konsult har du en förmåga att samarbeta och anpassa din kommunikation för att förklara komplexa lösningar på olika nivåer. Du är lyhörd för behov, förutsättningar och möjligheter och kan omsätta dessa till tydliga mål och en effektiv leverans. Du är flytande i svenska och engelska.

title: Solution Architect - SuccessFactors
description:
*Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i att vidareutveckla och driva HR-system i en organisation med starkt fokus på tillväxt och innovation? Vi söker nu en engagerad och kunnig SuccessFactors Solution Architect till en viktig ledarroll i vårt framåtriktade interna IT-team!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som SuccessFactors Solution Architect kommer du att ha en central roll i vår interna IT-organisation och arbeta nära HR-funktionen. Du kommer att bidra till att optimera och utveckla vår gruppgemensamma SuccessFactors-lösning med ett holistiskt perspektiv. Rollen innebär att du kommer att delta i strategiska diskussioner kring HR-teknologins framtida utveckling och säkerställa att vi som organisation aktivt drar nytta av den senaste teknologin. Du kommer att ha breda kontaktytor och arbeta i en miljö som värdesätter innovation och förbättring.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Ansvara för den tekniska arkitekturen och driften av SuccessFactors
* Implementera och optimera processflöden och integrationer i SuccessFactors
* Vara kontaktperson och tekniskt stöd för HR och andra interna stakeholders
* Stötta och driva projekt för nyutveckling, implementering och uppgraderingar av SuccessFactors
* Utveckla integrationslösningar mot andra system (exempelvis ServiceNow eller lönesystem)
* Ansvara för konfiguration och implementation av ny funktionalitet
* Leda implementeringen av SuccessFactors cloud-releaser för att säkerställa att vi utnyttjar den senaste teknologin
* Ansvara för felsökning och problemlösning i SuccessFactors
* Säkerställa att systemet följer både interna och externa krav på säkerhet och regelefterlevnad


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Akademisk examen inom IT eller motsvarande
* God tidigare erfarenhet som Solution Architect (Functional Architect) eller motsvarande roll med djupgående kunskap inom en eller flera av marknadens större HCM-plattformar, t.ex. SAP SuccessFactors, Workday eller Oracle HCM Cloud
* Experterfarenhet av konfigurering och god kunskap om samtliga moduler inom SuccessFactors (t.ex. Employee Central, Performance and Goal Management, Learning Management, etc.)
* God förståelse för integrationer och datamodeller inom HR-systemlandskap
* Erfarenhet av att samarbeta med olika intressenter och förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett enkelt och pedagogiskt sätt
* Erfarenhet av IT-projektledning
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Certifieringar inom SuccessFactors
* Grundläggande förståelse för SAP’s integrationsplattform CPI
* Erfarenhet av IT-projektledning


 Som person har du en stark analytisk förmåga och kan se helheten i komplexa IT-system och HR-processer. Du är självständig och leveranssäker i ditt arbete med lätt för såväl reaktiv som proaktiv problemlösning. Ditt team lägger stort fokus på innovation och utveckling och vi ser därför gärna att du delar vårt intresse för att se möjligheter i varje process.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och senior roll i en organisation som värdesätter innovation och förbättring. Du får möjligheten att arbeta med de senaste HR-teknologierna i en miljö med starkt fokus på digitalisering. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och tillitsbaserad arbetsmiljö där din kompetens och erfarenhet gör skillnad, samt goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling och påverkan inom din roll.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-02**

title: Domain Architect - Platform
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 As a Domain Architect (DA), you are a lighthouse in the engineering organization. You will be responsible for designing, optimizing, and governing the architecture within your domain, with a primary focus on evolving key platforms and systems. You will ensure that solutions are scalable, reliable, and aligned with overall enterprise architecture, business objectives, and industry best practices.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Domain Architecture Design: Develop and maintain a scalable, resilient, and business-aligned architecture for the domain.
* Collaboration: Work with stakeholders, architects, and engineering teams to ensure architectural consistency and effective implementation.
* Governance and Standards: Define, enforce, and validate architectural standards, best practices, and compliance requirements.
* Strategic Planning: Shape the domain’s technical roadmap and align it with long-term IT strategy and emerging technologies.
* Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks related to security, compliance, and technology obsolescence.
* Continuous Improvement: Evolve architecture based on business needs, technology trends, and stakeholder feedback.
* Documentation and Reporting: Maintain clear documentation and provide leadership with regular architecture updates.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* Technical Expertise: Deep understanding of technologies and tools related to cloud platforms (GCP), Java/Kotlin + Spring Boot framework, MySQL and Kafka.
* Strategic Thinking: Ability to align domain-specific solutions with broader business and IT strategies.
* Communication Skills: Strong ability to articulate complex architectural concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to tackle domain-specific challenges.
* Leadership: Ability to lead and mentor teams, driving collaboration across multiple departments and influencing architectural decisions.


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Previous experience from the industry of iGaming, banking or other high transactional solutions.


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Software Engineer - Data Infrastructure - Kafka
description:
Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to provide multi-cloud and on-premise data solutions for the enterprise. The data platform team is a collaborative team that develops a managed solutions for a full range of data stores and data technologies, spanning from big data, through NoSQL, cache-layer capabilities, and analytics; all the way to structured SQL engines (similar to Amazon RDS approach).
   

  

 We are facing the interesting problem of fault-tolerant mission-critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering managed data platforms.
   

  

 We are looking for candidates from junior to senior level with interests, experience and willingness to learn around Big Data technologies, such as distributed event-stores (Kafka) and parallel computing frameworks (Spark). Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open-source community dynamics and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organisations.
   

  

 Location: This is a Globally remote role
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

 The data platform team is responsible for the automation of data platform operations, with the mission of managing and integrating Big Data platforms at scale. This includes ensuring fault-tolerant replication, TLS, installation, backups and much more; but also provides domain-specific expertise on the actual data system to other teams within Canonical. This role is focused on the creation and automation of infrastructure features of data platforms, not analysing and/or processing the data in them.
   

  

* Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
* Write high-quality, idiomatic Python code to create new features
* Debug issues and interact with upstream communities publicly
* Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
* Work from home with global travel for 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Proven hands-on experience in software development using Python
* Proven hands-on experience in distributed systems, such as Kafka and Spark
* Have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM, or a similar degree
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
 You might also bring a subset of experience from the followings that can help Data Platform to achieve its challenging goals and determine the level we will consider you for:
   

  

* Experience operating and managing other data platform technologies, SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc) and/or NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis, ElasticSearch, etc), similar to DBA level expertise
* Experience with Linux systems administration, package management, and infrastructure operations
* Experience with the public cloud or a private cloud solution like OpenStack
* Experience with operating Kubernetes clusters and a belief that it can be used for serious persistent data services


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues twice a year
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal-opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Marketing Manager
company_industry: Retail, IT System Custom Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Are you a strategic and experienced Marketing Manager with a passion for the retail industry?** 
 Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can make a real impact? If so, we invite you to join our team!
 



  





**About Extenda Retail** 




  





 Extenda Retail is a leading SaaS provider within retail technology. Our solutions span from cutting-edge Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) and cloud native POS to unified commerce solutions with machine learning and loyalty solutions. We own the entire product lifecycle, from vision and creation to implementation and support, offering our clients a comprehensive and seamless experience. We are passionate about helping businesses optimize their operations, improve efficiency, and achieve sustainable growth.
 



  





 With a strong market presence in the Nordics and Benelux, we are now focused on continue to expand our reach across Europe. To achieve this ambitious goal, we are seeking a talented Marketing Manager for a fixed-term contract for one year to cover a maternity leave.
 



  





**We are looking for a** 
 highly motivated and results-oriented Marketing Manager to lead our team and drive our marketing strategy forward. You have a proven track record of success in B2B SaaS marketing, ideally within the retail technology sector. You possess strong leadership, communication, and analytical skills, and are comfortable working both strategically and hands-on.
 



  





**In this role you will** 
 be responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive marketing strategy that supports our European expansion plans. You will lead and inspire a team of marketing specialists, ensuring alignment with sales and business development goals.
 



  





**Your mission is to** 
 increase brand awareness, generate qualified leads, and enable sales growth across Europe through marketing activities. You will play a key role in positioning our company as a selected vendor of digital retail solutions.
 



  





**Responsibilities of the role:** 



* Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing marketing team comprising creative, digital, field, and growth marketing specialists.
* Create press releases and manage media distribution
* Develop and implement a data-driven marketing strategy aligned with our business objectives and market expansion goals.
* Define and track key marketing KPIs, ensuring continuous improvement and optimization of campaigns.
* Oversee all marketing activities, including digital marketing, content marketing, events, public relations, and account-based marketing (ABM).
* Lead ABM initiatives targeting key retail accounts across Europe.
* Collaborate closely with Sales and Business Development to ensure seamless lead management and nurture qualified prospects.
* Manage the marketing budget effectively and efficiently.
* Conduct performance reviews and provide constructive feedback to the marketing team.
* Stay informed about industry trends and best practices.



  





**We believe you have...** 



* A strong leadership style with the ability to motivate and guide a team.
* A strategic mindset and a proven ability to develop and execute successful marketing plans.
* A data-driven approach to decision-making and campaign optimization.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* A collaborative and results-oriented approach.



  





**Your skills and requirements:** 



* Bachelor's degree in Marketing or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in B2B SaaS marketing, preferably with a focus on the retail industry.
* Demonstrated success in developing and implementing marketing strategies that drive lead generation and sales growth.
* Strong understanding of digital marketing channels, including SEO, SEM, social media, and email marketing.
* Experience with account-based marketing (ABM) and lead nurturing strategies.
* Excellent project management skills.
* Fluency in English (Swedish is a plus).
* Location is based in Stockholm or Gothenburg, Sweden.
* This is a one-year fixed-term position!



  





**If you are a passionate and experienced marketing professional seeking a challenging and rewarding opportunity in a dynamic and growing company, we encourage you to apply!**

title: Solution Architect till Wholesale Solutions på ICA Sverige
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
ICA Sverige står inför en mycket spännande framtid med implementationen av ett nytt ERP-system för vår partihandelsverksamhet och letar nu efter en engagerad Solution Architect. Drivs du också av spännande IT-lösningar inom detaljhandeln, sök idag!
   

  

 Om jobbet som Solution Architect
   

  

 Wholesale Solutions inom Digital & Technology ansvarar för verksamhetsutveckling och IT inom hela partihandelsdelen av ICA Sverige - allt från drift, förvaltning och utveckling av ICA Sveriges applikationer och verksamhetsprocesser.
   

  

 Som solution architect på ICA Sverige jobbar du med den övergripande utvecklingen av lösningar i vårt nya ERP, Infor M3 i förhållande till befintliga applikationer på ICA. Först i form av projektarbete och sedan löpande vidareutveckling. En solution architect har gedigen erfarenhet från den domän, verksamhet eller IT, som initiativet kräver, samt god förståelse för viktiga kvalitetsattribut såsom prestanda, skalbarhet, robusthet, underhåll och flexibilitet och kan balansera dem mot de funktionella behoven. Lösningsarkitektens intresseområde är både att säkerställa projektets framgång, ha förmåga att skapa en hållbar lösning samtidigt som ICA Sveriges övergripande strategier följs. Du kommer ha ansvar för funktionell och teknisk lösningsarkitektur inom Supply Chain Execution med kunskap av lösningar inom logistik men även angränsande områden såsom prishantering, artikelstrukturer, masterdata osv inom Order to Cash och Procure to Pay-processerna.
   

  

 Teamet sitter i Solna och består av 15 kollegor som ansvarar för att planera och leverera förändringar, support och drift av ICAs köpta system inom området.
   

  

 Är du den vi söker?
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig som har mer än 3 års erfarenhet av att ha jobbat med någon av de stora ERP-systemen såsom SAP, Infor M3 eller Oracle Fusion i en liknande roll antingen i linjebefattning eller som konsult. Du har varit lösningsansvarig eller funktionellt ansvarig i stora projekt eller jobbat i löpande verksamhet med något av dessa system inom en bransch som är närliggande ICA där CPG och FMCG är bekanta begrepp. Förutom IT så ligger Supply Chain dig varmt om hjärtat.
   

  

 Du kan också ha djup kunskap av ICA Sverige specifikt inom Supply Chain eller Merchandising och det systemlandskap som finns idag och är villig att lära dig ett nytt system. Vi ser därför gärna interna sökande till denna position.
   

  

 Då ICA implementerar Infor M3 så är det klart meriterande med erfarenhet av specifikt detta system.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är kvalitetsmedveten och noggrann. Du är utåtriktad och kommunikativ med stor förmåga att skapa och bibehålla både interna och externa relationer, samtidigt som du är en god ledare av dig själv och andra. Flexibilitet och förmåga att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt är av stor vikt. Förutom att hantera operativa frågeställningar är det viktigt att du är proaktiv och tänker strategiskt.
   

  

 För att vara aktuell för denna roll behöver du tala och skriva både svenska och engelska obehindrat samt ha en högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande utbildning med relevant inriktning.
   

  

 Vad händer nu?
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, senast 2025-04-27, då urval sker löpande. För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef Richard Belec, 0702 967574.
   

  

 ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Denna roll kräver att du genomgår tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.

title: Infor M3 Business Analyst
description:
Systemspecialist
   

  

 Infor M3 Business Analyst
   

  

 Har du några års erfarenhet av Infor M3 och är specialist i en eller flera moduler av systemet? Vill du utvecklas ytterligare och få vara med på en spännande ERP-transformation? Vill du bidra med din kunskap i en storskalig M3 Cloud-utrullning och vara en del av ett samarbetsinriktat team?
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Nu söker Dreamwork för kunds räkning flera personer som kommer arbeta som M3 Business Analyst. Det är en intern roll hos ett svenskt bolag som finns på flera platser i Sverige och i utlandet. Placeringsort kan vara Göteborg, Stockholm eller Växjö.
   

  

 Oavsett om du har djup expertis eller är i början av din M3 Cloud-resa, kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att säkerställa att vår M3 Cloud-lösning är optimerad, sömlöst integrerad och anpassad till våra operativa behov.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av en eller flera moduler i Infor M3. Vi använder oss främst av affärsprocesserna i Order to Cach, Supply Chain/ WMS, Procurement & Product Quality / Procure to pay och Financial Management. Har du erfarenhet av IFS eller SAP ser vi det som likvärdigt med M3.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden
   

  

* Stödja implementeringen och utrullningen av Infor M3 Cloud inom hela organisationen, både i Sverige och utlandet. Resor kan förekomma inom Europa.
* Hjälpa till att konfigurera M3 Cloud för att matcha verksamhetens krav
* Säkerställa smidig integration mellan M3 Cloud och andra affärskritiska system
* Samarbeta med interna team och leverantörer för att säkerställa systemkompatibilitet
* Felsöka och lösa problem relaterade till M3 Cloud och systemintegrationer
* Ge utbildning och support till slutanvändare


**Vad Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Infor M3 Cloud, antingen vid implementationsprojekt eller i daglig drift
* God kunskap om Infor M3 och relaterade program som stöder affärsplaneringsprocesser
* God förståelse för M3s affärsprocesser; Order to Cach, Supply Chain/ WMS, Procurement & Product Quality / Procure to pay och Financial Management
* Intresse eller erfarenhet av systemintegrationer mellan M3 Cloud och externa applikationer
* Förmåga att samarbeta med olika team och översätta affärsbehov till systemlösningar
* Erfarenhet av affärsanalys och kravprocesser
* Problemlösningsförmåga och en vilja att lära dig mer
* Starka kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska


 Varför ska du välja oss?
   

  

* Du blir en del av ett välmående bolag som verkar internationellt och utvecklar varumärken inom olika produktkategorier. Bolaget riktar sig till både företag och konsumenter, med fokus på bred marknadstäckning och hållbar tillväxt. Med verksamhet i flera länder och ett väletablerat nätverk arbetar företaget kontinuerligt med att utveckla sitt erbjudande och stärka sin position på marknaden.
* Du får vara med om en omfattande M3 Cloud-utrullning
* Du får arbeta i ett dynamiskt och stöttande team där lärande och samarbete står i fokus
* Du erbjuds mycket goda möjligheter till karriärutveckling i en spännande och innovativ miljö


 Ansökan
   

  

 Denna rekrytering hanteras av Dreamwork för kunds räkning. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid i Göteborg, Stockholm eller Växjö. Hybridarbetsplats tillämpas. Tillträde till tjänsten är enligt överenskommelse. Du söker tjänsten på http://www.dreamwork.se eller http://www.poolia.se Vänligen bifoga CV och personligt brev.
   

  

 Vi kommer att kalla till intervjuer löpande så sök gärna tjänsten så snart som möjligt. Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Christina Martinsson, ansvarig rekryterare på Dreamwork, 0735-180904 eller christina.martinsson@dreamwork.se
